The results for each piece of software that cannot be automatically updated can be found in [result.txt](https://gist.github.com/SorYoshino/d3133dd958e76d971d5f44ebe8c81c0c).
summary.otherNotes: The GitHub repository for OpenArk, its homepage, and even the author's GitHub profile are no longer available. I will try to contact the author to inquire whether the software will continue to be developed. Yes, confirmed. It may be caused by network issues. I'll remove it. This list above was obtained using a simple matching script and may contain false positives. Following does not seem to have a problem anymore: * blender * gpu-z * throttlestop. The GitHub page has been maliciously shut down, but development will continue. Currently, there doesn't seem to be a stable download link available, so we need to wait for updates from the upstream source. Should this manifest be modified to use a working download URL while we continue waiting for upstream updates? Or should we simply deprecate it? For now, let's keep it in the Extras bucket. tanoshi: Project is dead/removed, this fork seems like the defacto replacement: <https://github.com/luigi311/tanoshi>. The following applications do not have stable releases and should be moved to the **Versions** bucket: * xplorer * vidi * olive-editor. Hello, @z-Fng . A Super-fast account switcher for Steam, Battle.net, Epic Games, Origin, Riot, Ubisoft and many others! The description above is for `tcno-acc-switcher`. It seems more suitable for the Games bucket. Should we move it to the Games bucket? Or should we continue maintaining it in the Extras bucket? For now, let's keep it in the Extras bucket. openark has now launched a new official website and added download links. I will submit a pull request shortly to update the existing manifest. The latest release of `i2pdbrowser` has a `tag_name` of **latest**, and the file `I2PdBrowserPortable_$version.7z` uses **473cdfe** as its version identifier. I think this manifest does not need to be fixed at the moment, as the actual version number cannot be determined, and future versioning patterns remain unpredictable. This uncertainty makes it difficult to properly configure both `checkver` and `autoupdate`. moar has been confirmed as deprecated and does not require fixing. We don't have enough maintainers/collaborators to handle the migration right now, so the conclusion remains the same: For now, let's keep it in the Extras bucket. This issue is just for tracking broken manifests and may not resolve all of them at once. Unfortunately, due to upstream changes or other external factors, the number of issues may continue to grow. Combined with the limited number of active contributors and maintainers, it has become increasingly difficult to address them effectively. `stellarium` is fixed, they added an arm64 installer to v25.3: * <https://github.com/Stellarium/stellarium/issues/4604>. We might need to revisit our deprecation mechanism I guess? I agree with this view. I believe manifests that have not been updated for a long time should be automatically deprecated. For example, manifests that have not been automatically updated for three years after being added to the Main or Extras buckets should automatically enter the deprecation process, and those that remain unupdated for five years should be forcibly deprecated. Special cases may allow for a slight delay or exemption. Manifests in the Versions bucket could have a slightly extended timeframe. I am not sure whether such an automated process is feasible, but I hope this could provide some direction for improving the deprecation mechanism. In addition, I think manifests added to buckets should also have an update-time requirement. For example, manifests added to the Main or Extras buckets should have received an update within the last three years before inclusion, while those in the Versions bucket should have been updated within the last five years. If these conditions are not met, the decision to include them should depend on the popularity of the software. I have noticed that some manifests in the Extras bucket had not been updated for over five years even before being added, and those manifests have still not received new updates to this day.

issueDTO.title: Update all analyzers to output `<struct name>.<field name>` for more precise error message output
issueDTO.description:
We have found both in `conditions` and `conflictingmarkers` that the error messages containing just the field name has proven difficult to build precise enough exceptions when existing issues cannot be resolved.

We should take the utils introduced in https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kube-api-linter/pull/156 and make sure that all of our analyzers leverage the same pattern.

We may want to handle this through our inspector helper so that the field and struct name (or just combined name?) are returned as one of the arguments for the analyzers to use

- ARM management APIs for all clouds
- Telemetry collection
- Experimentation
- CLI tools including github, etc
- Customer URLs including their own app urls for application publishing
- ...

issueDTO.title: Update design of dropdown menus to align with top nav
issueDTO.description: ### Checklist - [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests. - [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue. ### Summary Our dropdown menus currently look like below, e.g. for `st.selectbox`: But we want them to look like the new style we added for page sections in top navigation (i.e. if `st.navigation(..., position="top")` is set): ### Why? Looks more modern. ### How? Need to go through all our dropdowns and update. ### Additional Context Related: #12954
comments:
**To help Streamlit prioritize this feature, react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-12956)

Hey @jrieke !
Can you assign this to me? I'm new to open source and would love to tackle this as my first contribution. I'm particularly interested in this issue because:

It seems like a great entry point to understand Streamlit's UI components and styling system
The clear before/after examples make it easy to understand what needs to be achieved

I'd appreciate the opportunity to work on this and any guidance you can provide along the way. Thanks!
One thing we should probably improve if we're going to be using this component more widely is the a11y of the component. For example, you cannot open the dropdown with the keyboard at the moment.

@sfc-gh-nbellante 

just to confirm my understanding:

The original issue around updating the dropdown visuals appears to be mostly a CSS / styling change (matching the new top-nav dropdown style).

The a11y improvement you mentioned ??? like enabling opening the dropdown via keyboard ??? would likely involve logic changes at the component or backend interaction level, beyond just styling.

Since I'm just starting out, would it make sense for me to first focus on the styling update as the base fix, and then create a follow-up issue or PR for the keyboard-accessibility enhancement?
Or would you prefer both to be handled together within the same PR?

Hey @rishi-kumar0612! 

I want to clarify the scope of this issue, as it's actually more involved than it might initially appear.

**What needs to be done**

  The goal is to update the dropdown menus used by several widgets to match the visual style of the new top navigation dropdown. The widgets that need updating include:

  - st.selectbox - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/lib/src/components/shared/Dropdown/Selectbox.tsx
  - st.multiselect - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/lib/src/components/widgets/Multiselect/Multiselect.tsx
  - st.time_input - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/lib/src/components/widgets/TimeInput/TimeInput.tsx
  - st.dataframe column filters (uses the shared Dropdown component)
  - App menu dropdowns

  **The target style**

  The new dropdown style you want to match is implemented in the top navigation's dropdown menu:
  - TopNavSection component:
  https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/app/src/components/Navigation/TopNavSection.tsx#L77-L193
  - Styled components:
  https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/app/src/components/Navigation/styled-components.ts#L323-L330

Note that the top nav dropdown uses BaseWeb's Popover component (lines 77-193) with custom styling overrides, including the rounded corners (theme.radii.xl), specific shadows, and borders.

  **Why this is more than just CSS**

The current widgets use BaseWeb's Select component, which has its own dropdown implementation. To match the top nav style, you'll likely need to override the Dropdown component prop in the Select's overrides (similar to how VirtualDropdown is used at https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/develop/frontend/lib/src/components/shared/Dropdown/Selectbox.tsx#L174) and apply the new styling to match the StyledPopoverContent from the top nav.

The key styling changes to replicate are:
  - Border radius: theme.radii.xl (all corners)
  - Box shadow: conditional based on light/dark theme
  - Border styling: consistent 1px solid borders
  - Padding: theme.spacing.twoXS vertical, 0 horizontal
  - Margins: specific top/right spacing

**About my earlier a11y comment**

After thinking through the implementation more carefully, I realize my earlier comment about keyboard accessibility isn't actually relevant to this issue. The widgets you'd be updating (st.selectbox, st.multiselect, etc.) already have proper keyboard support through BaseWeb's Select component, and updating the visual styling won't affect that. So you can disregard that concern???it's not applicable here.

**Recommendation**

Given that this involves:
  1. Updating multiple widget components across the codebase
  2. Understanding BaseWeb's override system and Emotion styling
  3. Creating custom dropdown components or overrides
  4. Testing changes across all affected widgets

This is actually a moderate-to-advanced level contribution, not quite a "good first issue" in practice. However, if you're comfortable with React, TypeScript, and Emotion, it could be a great learning opportunity!

I'd suggest starting with just st.selectbox as a proof of concept, then we can review that approach before rolling it out to the other widgets. This way you get feedback early and avoid having to rework multiple components.

Does this help clarify the scope? Let me know if you have questions about the approach!

Hey @sfc-gh-nbellante !

Thanks so much for the detailed breakdown???this really helps clarify the scope.

I understand this is more involved than a typical "good first issue," but I'm comfortable with React, TypeScript, and Emotion, so I'm up for the challenge!

Your suggestion to start with st.selectbox as a proof of concept makes perfect sense. I'll focus on that first and get it working before expanding to the other widgets.

My plan:

- Study the TopNavSection.tsx and its styled components to understand the target style
- Modify Selectbox.tsx (or VirtualDropdown) to match the new dropdown styling
- Test thoroughly with a sample script
- Open a draft PR for early feedback before rolling out to other widgets

I'll start working on this and reach out if I hit any blockers. Should I ping you here when I have the st.selectbox proof of concept ready for review?


Thanks again for the guidance!

Hey @sfc-gh-nbellante and @jrieke! 

I've created a draft PR implementing the new dropdown styling for `st.selectbox` as discussed: #13004 

As suggested, I started with just the selectbox as a proof of concept. The changes include:
- ??? Rounded corners (`theme.radii.xl`) matching TopNav
- ??? Conditional shadows for light/dark themes
- ??? Consistent 1px borders
- ??? Proper padding structure

All tests pass and I've verified the styling matches the top navigation dropdown. Ready for review!

Once this approach is approved, I can roll out the same changes to `st.multiselect`, `st.time_input`, and the other dropdowns mentioned.

@DonnieBLT I'll implement the Flutter feature to display installed apps in an autocomplete field when reporting bugs. Based on the requirements, I'll:

1. Add a modern package for retrieving installed apps (device_apps was mentioned but is deprecated)
2. Create an autocomplete widget for the URL field in the bug report screen
3. Store both the app name and package ID when selected
4. Handle platform differences between Android and iOS

Here's the implementation:

First, let's update the pubspec.yaml file to add the necessary dependency:

```yaml
# Add this to pubspec.yaml under dependencies:
  installed_apps: ^1.3.1
```

Now, let's modify the report_bug.dart file to implement the autocomplete widget:

```dart
import 'package:installed_apps/app_info.dart';
import 'package:installed_apps/installed_apps.dart';

// Inside _ReportFormState class:

// Add these variables
List<AppInfo> _installedApps = [];
String? _selectedAppPackage;
bool _isLoadingApps = false;

@override
void initState() {
  super.initState();
  _checkStatus();
  getAvailableLabels();
  if (widget.reportPageDefaults.sharedMediaFile != null) {
    _image = [File(widget.reportPageDefaults.sharedMediaFile!.path)];
  }
  if (widget.reportPageDefaults.text != null) {
    _titleController.text = widget.reportPageDefaults.text!;
  }
  if (widget.company != null &&
      widget.company?.url != null &&
      widget.company?.url != "") {
    _titleController.text = widget.company!.url!;
  }
  addFocusListener();
  _loadInstalledApps(); // Add this line to load apps on init
}

// Add this new method to load installed apps
Future<void> _loadInstalledApps() async {
  setState(() {
    _isLoadingApps = true;
  });
  
  try {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      final apps = await InstalledApps.getInstalledApps(true, true);
      setState(() {
        _installedApps = apps;
        _isLoadingApps = false;
      });
    } else {
      // iOS doesn't support listing all installed apps due to system restrictions
      setState(() {
        _installedApps = [];
        _isLoadingApps = false;
      });
    }
  } catch (e) {
    print('Error loading installed apps: $e');
    setState(() {
      _isLoadingApps = false;
    });
  }
}

// Replace the TextFormField in the build method with this Autocomplete widget:
// Find the TextFormField with controller: _titleController and replace it with:

Autocomplete<AppInfo>(
  optionsBuilder: (TextEditingValue textEditingValue) {
    if (textEditingValue.text.isEmpty) {
      return const Iterable<AppInfo>.empty();
    }
    
    return _installedApps.where((AppInfo app) {
      return app.name.toLowerCase().contains(textEditingValue.text.toLowerCase()) ||
             app.packageName.toLowerCase().contains(textEditingValue.text.toLowerCase());
    }).take(5); // Limit to 5 suggestions for performance
  },
  displayStringForOption: (AppInfo app) => app.name,
  fieldViewBuilder: (
    BuildContext context,
    TextEditingController fieldController,
    FocusNode fieldFocusNode,
    VoidCallback onFieldSubmitted,
  ) {
    // Sync our internal controller with the field controller
    if (_titleController.text.isNotEmpty && fieldController.text.isEmpty) {
      fieldController.text = _titleController.text;
    }
    
    return TextFormField(
      controller: fieldController,
      focusNode: fieldFocusNode,
      validator: (value) {
        if (value == null || value.isEmpty) {
          return AppLocalizations.of(context)!.requiredField;
        }
        return null;
      },
      onChanged: (v) {
        _titleController.text = v; // Keep our controller in sync
        if (duplicateVerified) {
          setState(() {
            duplicateVerified = false;
          });
        }
        _selectedAppPackage = null; // Reset package if text is changed
      },
      decoration: InputDecoration(
        hintText: (fieldFocusNode.hasFocus)
            ? AppLocalizations.of(context)!.exampleURL
            : AppLocalizations.of(context)!.url,
        suffixIcon: _isLoadingApps 
            ? SizedBox(width: 20, height: 20, child: CircularProgressIndicator(strokeWidth: 2))
            : Platform.isAndroid ? Icon(Icons.apps) : null,
        enabledBorder: OutlineInputBorder(
          borderRadius: BorderRadius.all(
            Radius.circular(8.0),
          ),
          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.grey),
        ),
        focusedBorder: OutlineInputBorder(
          borderRadius: BorderRadius.all(
            Radius.circular(8.0),
          ),
          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.grey),
        ),
        contentPadding:
            EdgeInsets.only(top: 8.0, left: 16.0, right: 16.0),
      ),
      cursorColor: Color(0xFFDC4654),
      style: GoogleFonts.aBeeZee(
        textStyle: TextStyle(
          fontSize: 12,
        ),
      ),
    );
  },
  onSelected: (AppInfo selection) {
    setState(() {
      _titleController.text = selection.name;
      _selectedAppPackage = selection.packageName;
    });
  },
  optionsViewBuilder: (
    BuildContext context,
    AutocompleteOnSelected<AppInfo> onSelected,
    Iterable<AppInfo> options,
  ) {
    return Align(
      alignment: Alignment.topLeft,
      child: Material(
        elevation: 4.0,
        child: ConstrainedBox(
          constraints: BoxConstraints(
            maxHeight: 200,
            maxWidth: MediaQuery.of(context).size.width - 40, // Account for padding
          ),
          child: ListView.builder(
            padding: EdgeInsets.zero,
            shrinkWrap: true,
            itemCount: options.length,
            itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
              final AppInfo option = options.elementAt(index);
              return ListTile(
                leading: option.icon != null 
                    ? Image.memory(option.icon!, width: 30, height: 30)
                    : Icon(Icons.android),
                title: Text(option.name),
                subtitle: Text(option.packageName),
                onTap: () {
                  onSelected(option);
                },
              );
            },
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  },
),
```

Also, modify the Issue class to include the package ID when submitting the bug report:

```dart
// In the "onPressed" method of the "Add Issue" button, modify the Issue creation:

Issue issue = Issue(
  user: currentUser!,
  url: _titleController.text,
  title: _titleController.text,
  description: _descriptionController.text,
  isVerified: false,
  isOpen: true,
  screenshotsLink: _image.map((e) => e.path).toList(),
  userAgent: "Dart ${Platform.version.substring(0, 7) + Platform.operatingSystem}",
  label: _selectedIssueCategoriesIndex,
  tags: tags,
  appPackageId: _selectedAppPackage, // Add this line to include the package ID
);
```

This implementation:
1. Uses the installed_apps package to get a list of installed apps on Android
2. Creates an autocomplete widget that shows app icons, names, and package IDs
3. Stores both the app name (visible in the text field) and package ID (hidden)
4. Handles platform differences (showing app list only on Android as iOS has restrictions)

The autocomplete works for both manual entry and selecting from installed apps, maintaining the existing functionality while adding the new feature.

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: All Users.CreateUser... endpoints return a vague server error is null name is provided
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

POST to /v1/users or any of the "create user with ___ password" endpoints
Create body with a defined UserId, and a `name: null`.
Observe the vague server error

### 👍 Expected behavior

No server error, should continue creating the user with no name. Name is optional anyway, so specifying it as null should not create this error.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/835e2c3f-dd8b-453d-8d61-2c6a85a0d1ec)


### 🎲 Appwrite version

Appwrite Cloud

### 💻 Operating system

Windows

### 🧱 Your Environment

I am developing my own SDK, hence running into this issue. I can work around it of course, but there shouldn't be a reason for this to occur in the first place. I have replicated it using postman to eliminate any possible issues at a deeper level within my own SDK.

Wasn't sure if you would care about this sort of issue, but received no answer on Discord as to whether to file this or not.

### 👀 Have you spent some time to check if this issue has been raised before?

- [x] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Code of Conduct?

- [x] I have read the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/appwrite/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments:
Looks like the error in the backend is:

```
{closure}(): Argument #5 ($name) must be of type string, null given, called in /usr/src/code/vendor/utopia-php/framework/src/App.php on line 531
```

because `$name` is supposed to be a string and not null here:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/a49c3a33f0fd831423afa7a0b53df2c5d709fc2b/app/controllers/api/users.php#L207

There's a Text validator here:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/a49c3a33f0fd831423afa7a0b53df2c5d709fc2b/app/controllers/api/users.php#L201

but it seems like it doesn't run when the [param is optional and the value is null](https://github.com/utopia-php/servers/blob/fd5c8d32778f265256c1936372a071b944f5ba8a/src/Servers/Base.php#L293-L295).

We should probably make the param nullable and if null was passed, create the user with empty string for name.

🎯 Agentic Issue Triage

**Summary:** Sending `null` for optional parameters like `name` in Users API endpoints (CreateUser, CreateTarget, UpdateTarget, CreateToken) causes a vague server error instead of treating it as an empty/omitted parameter. This affects SDK development where null values should be handled gracefully.

<details>
<summary>(strong)📋 Issue Analysis(/strong)</summary>

**Type:** Bug Report - API Parameter Validation

**Component:** Auth / Users API, Backend Validation

**Severity:** Low-Medium - Causes confusing errors but has simple workarounds

**Environment:**
- Appwrite Cloud
- Affects multiple Users API endpoints

**Affected Endpoints** (reported by `@pingu2k4`):
1. **Create User** - `name` parameter
2. **Create User Target** - `name`, `providerId` parameters
3. **Update User Target** - `name`, `providerId`, `identifier` parameters
4. **Create Token** - `length`, `expire` parameters

**Issue History:**
- Reported Oct 10, 2024
- `@stnguyen90` diagnosed the root cause
- Marked as "good first issue"
- Multiple community members have expressed interest
- Currently assigned to `@vaifai` (as of Nov 7, 2024)
- No PR submitted yet despite time elapsed

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)🔍 Root Cause Analysis(/strong)</summary>

**From `@stnguyen90`'s Diagnosis:**

The error occurs because:
```php
{closure}(): Argument #5 ($name) must be of type string, null given
```

**Problem:** In `/app/controllers/api/users.php`:
- Line 207: `$name` parameter expects type `string`
- Line 201: Has a Text validator
- Validator doesn't run when param is optional and value is `null` (per utopia-php/servers behavior)

**Solution:**
> We should probably make the param nullable and if null was passed, create the user with empty string for name.

**Technical Details:**
- Utopia framework skips validators for optional params when null is provided
- Function signature expects string, not nullable string
- Need to update function signatures to accept `string|null`
- Convert null to empty string internally

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)💡 Implementation Approach(/strong)</summary>

**Code Changes Required:**

1. **Update Function Signatures:**
```php
// Before
function($name, ...) 

// After  
function(?string $name, ...)
```

2. **Handle Null Values:**
```php
$name = $name ?? '';
```

3. **Affected Files:**
- `/app/controllers/api/users.php` - CreateUser endpoints
- Target creation/update endpoints
- Token creation endpoints

4. **Testing:**
- Test with `null` values
- Test with empty strings
- Test with valid strings
- Verify no breaking changes for existing clients

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)🔧 Endpoints Needing Fixes(/strong)</summary>

Based on reporter's findings:

1. **Users:**
   - `POST /v1/users` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/md5` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/bcrypt` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/sha` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/argon2` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/scrypt` - name parameter
   - `POST /v1/users/phpass` - name parameter

2. **Targets:**
   - `POST /v1/users/{userId}/targets` - name, providerId
   - `PATCH /v1/users/{userId}/targets/{targetId}` - name, providerId, identifier

3. **Tokens:**
   - `POST /v1/users/{userId}/tokens` - length, expire

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)📚 Resources(/strong)</summary>

- [Users API Reference]((redacted))
- [Utopia Framework Validation](https://github.com/utopia-php/framework)
- [PHP Nullable Types]((redacted)#language.types.declarations.nullable)

**Code References:**
- `/app/controllers/api/users.php` - Main implementation file
- Utopia validator behavior: [utopia-php/servers Base.php:293-295](https://github.com/utopia-php/servers/blob/fd5c8d32778f265256c1936372a071b944f5ba8a/src/Servers/Base.php#L293-L295)

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)??? Implementation Checklist(/strong)</summary>

- [ ] Update all affected endpoint signatures to accept nullable strings
- [ ] Add null coalescing to convert null to empty string
- [ ] Test CreateUser with null name
- [ ] Test CreateTarget with null name/providerId
- [ ] Test UpdateTarget with null parameters
- [ ] Test CreateToken with null length/expire
- [ ] Verify backwards compatibility
- [ ] Check if Account API has same issue (reporter says it doesn't)
- [ ] Add regression tests
- [ ] Update API documentation if needed

</details>

<details>
<summary>(strong)👥 Community Interest(/strong)</summary>

Multiple community members have expressed interest:

summary.validationOrRequirement: The error occurs because the function signature expects a string, not a nullable string, and the validator doesn't run when the param is optional and the value is null.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue was diagnosed by @stnguyen90, and the solution is to make the param nullable and if null was passed, create the user with empty string for name.
summary.otherNotes: Sending null for optional parameters like name in Users API endpoints (CreateUser, CreateTarget, UpdateTarget, CreateToken) causes a vague server error instead of treating it as an empty/omitted parameter. This affects SDK development where null values should be handled gracefully.

issueDTO.title: Add e2e tests for project
issueDTO.description:
Since we bumped to the latest operator-sdk we have a failing workflow for e2e tests. This is caused because this project doesn't have proper e2e tests implemented just yet.

For the quality guarantee of this project it would be good if we add the first coverage of e2e tests.

Probably check another operator on how to implement those.

issueDTO.title: New web dev proxy does not proxy query string
issueDTO.description:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open/create flutter web project
2. Setup dart proxy listening on port 8080 with the `web_dev_config.yaml` in the root of project with content : 
```
server:
  port: 8080
  proxy:
    - target: "http://localhost:5000"
      regex: "^/login"
```
3. Run a upstream http server (listening port 5000 here) : `$ python -m http.server 5000`
4. Run the flutter project with flutter run -d web-server
5. Request the proxy with a matching regex and query string `$ curl http://localhost:8080/login?foo=bar` or use code sample below and click to the middle button 
6. Check logs of the upstream webserver 
Reproduced with channel master + beta

### Expected results

Upstream server get request with query string. e.g :

`127.0.0.1 - - [07/Nov/2025 10:29:07] "GET /login?foo=bar HTTP/1.1" 404 -`

### Actual results

Upstream server does not receive query string

`127.0.0.1 - - [07/Nov/2025 10:31:04] "GET /login HTTP/1.1" 404 -`

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:http/http.dart' as http;


void main() {
  runApp(Bug());
}

class Bug extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Center(
          child: TextButton(
            onPressed: () async {
              final response = await http.get(Uri.parse("/login?foo=bar"));
            },
            child: Text("Request"),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

[Upload media here]

</details>

@kevmoo Same behavior with prefix. The request is effectively proxied but without query string. 

The base target uri is extracted from rule and resolved with the request path (i.e without query)

```
server:
  port: 8080
  proxy:
    - target: "http://localhost:5000/"
      prefix: "/login"


```
`$ curl http://localhost:8080/login?foo=bar`

issueDTO.title: add the ability to choose model and config/provider via command line param
issueDTO.description: It would be useful to have the ability to pick a config/provider and model via a command line param. This would enable workflows where multiple models are set to do the same task in parallel, using parallel mode, and then the user picks the best result.

issueDTO.title: gloo: support CUDA tensors and verify correctness (CPU reduction, CUDA tensor)
issueDTO.description:
We currently only test Gloo with CPU tensors. ProcessGroup in c10d supports both CUDA and CPU tensors. We have some basic code to support this but it hasn't been robustly tested / verified.

The test configurations in CI are controlled via: https://github.com/meta-pytorch/torchcomms/blob/main/comms/torchcomms/scripts/run_tests_integration_py.sh#L26-L32

Testing:

We want to test with CUDA backend and gloo.

For example to run the alltoall single test:

```sh
TEST_BACKEND=gloo TEST_DEVICE=cuda torchrun --nnodes 1 --nproc_per_node 4 comms/torchcomms/tests/integration/py/AllToAllSingleTest.py
```

We can also test E2E with torchtitan which should give a good indication if things are being handled incorrectly

Things to watch out for:

* making sure that we're copying back to the original device tensor for all operations
* making sure that we correctly synchronize the streams and doing the transfer on the right streams

Not necessarily part of this issue but also relevant:
* enabling ibverbs backend for Gloo
* enabling CUDA/GPU reductions for Gloo - this task is only covering CPU reduction for tensors originally located on the GPU

issueDTO.title: aws_placement_group enforces an incorrect partition_count limit
issueDTO.description:
### Terraform and AWS Provider Version

```console
Terraform v1.13.4
on darwin_arm64
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/aws v6.20.0
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/null v3.2.4
+ provider registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/vault v5.4.0
+ provider registry.terraform.io/mongey/kafka v0.13.1
```

### Affected Resource(s) or Data Source(s)

* aws_placement_group

### Expected Behavior

Placement groups using `partition` strategy should not enforce an upper limit of 7 and instead allow the AWS API to enforce limits, as this limit is mutable.
https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-aws/blob/main/internal/service/ec2/ec2_placement_group.go#L56

### Actual Behavior

Provider errors out when the partition count is greater than hard coded limit of 7.

### Relevant Error/Panic Output

```
Error: expected partition_count to be in the range (0 - 7), got 15
```

### Sample Terraform Configuration

<details open>
<summary>Click to expand configuration</summary>

```hcl
resource "aws_placement_group" "partitioned" {
  name            = "partitioned-placement-group"
  strategy        = "partition"
  partition_count = 8
}
```
</details>


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Attempt to create an `aws_placement_group` with `strategy = "partition"` and `partition_count` greater than 7.

### Debug Logging

n/a

### GenAI / LLM Assisted Development

n/a

### Important Facts and References

https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-aws/blob/main/internal/service/ec2/ec2_placement_group.go#L56

AWS allow modifying this limit, although it does not seem to be very publicly advertised, nor is it actually listed under service quotas - modification requires opening a support case (this functionality may be limited to enterprise support customers).

### Would you like to implement a fix?

No

issueDTO.title: Prefer token endpoint auth method obtained during OAuth client registration
comments: @thomasst I attempted a fix for this if you would like to try it out and confirm it works #982

Hitting this as well with our OAuth2 server. We always issue a `client_secret`, even if the `token_endpoint_auth_method` is set to `none`. MCP then tries to authenticate with a `client_secret_basic` method, but we reject it since the client expects `none`.

repository.description: The official TypeScript SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients
repository.name: typescript-sdk

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to ensure that the token endpoint auth method obtained during OAuth client registration is used instead of the one from the OAuth authorization server metadata, to avoid OAuth flow failures if a strict server requires the method that was posted and used during client registration.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The validation or requirement is to prefer the token_endpoint_auth_method from the client clientInformation that was obtained during registration, and only if it's unavailable fall back to the metadata from the OAuth authorization server.
summary.attemptedFixes: One attempted fix is mentioned in the comments, which is a fix for this issue if you would like to try it out and confirm it works (#982).
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about using the token endpoint auth method obtained during OAuth client registration instead of the one from the OAuth authorization server metadata. The client registration data includes the token_endpoint_auth_method, which should be used for requesting a token.

When connecting Notion to claude chat, you can see bellow how Notion mcp server includes it. My undestanding it's that the client will check this field to know whether it can use the dynamic client registration or not? Even in the registration handler https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk/blob/main/src/server/auth/handlers/register.ts#L83 you can see what we check for `none` to know whether it's a public client or not **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. issueDTO.title: Cannot destructure property 'requestInfo' of 'undefined' as it is undefined.
comments: I also found if `inputSchema` is not set in the tools, the second parameter is null too.

This appears to be caused by https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk/blob/3bc2235d747c320dfa0b6227cc84414c6d0add89/src/server/mcp.ts#L174. Notice how the callback, cb, is called with two parameters if there is an inputSchema and one parameter if there isn't (line 189). The same pattern is also used for prompts and resources.

This is reflected in the deprecated `tool` method - which exposed two different callback signatures depending on whether an input schema is present. But, is not reflected in the `registerTool` method - which always uses the two parameter callback.

issueDTO.title: OAuth token exchange fails with URL-encoded responses - assumes JSON format only

repository.description: The official TypeScript SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients
repository.name: typescript-sdk

summary.main: The OAuth token exchange fails with URL-encoded responses, assuming JSON format only, and the SDK should handle both common OAuth token response formats.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The exchangeAuthorization() function in client/auth.js assumes OAuth token responses are always in JSON format and calls response.json() directly. The SDK should handle both common OAuth token response formats: JSON format and URL-encoded format.
summary.attemptedFixes: The suggested fix is to handle both JSON and URL-encoded responses by adding an Accept request header to request a JSON response and parsing the response text using JSON.parse() or URLSearchParams.
summary.otherNotes: The issue can be reproduced using GitHub's MCP server at https://api.githubcopilot.com/mcp with proper GitHub OAuth app credentials. There is a related issue with GitHubs oAuth where by it does not expose it's oAuth info on .well-known/oauth-authorization-server, but rather returns a resource_metadata="https://api.githubcopilot.com/.well-known/oauth-protected-resource/mcp" param in the www-authenticate field (see #758).

issueDTO.title: Invalid JSON RPC requests do not respond with an error
issueDTO.description:
I noticed that this request:

```json
{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1, "method": "tools/lit", "params": {}}
```

... returns an error response (code -32601) as expected but this:

```json
{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1, "method_": "tools/list", "params": {}}
```

... returns nothing. I would expect that a missing `method` property or an unknown root property like `methodX` would throw and error. The [JSON-RPC 2.0 spec](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#error_object) says the server should return:

- **-32600 "Invalid Request"** for malformed JSON-RPC (missing required fields like `method`)
- **-32602 "Invalid params"** for bad parameters

I think the SDK should handle these but I'm not even able to write validation logic in my application code because an invalid RPC request never reaches my handler.

Claude tells me I can do something like this:

```typescript
class ValidatingStdioTransport extends StdioServerTransport {
  // Override message handling to add validation
}
```

.. but I don't love that. 

If a maintainer agrees that this validation should be in the SDK, I'd be more than happy to write a PR! Thank you for all your work on this!

repository.description: The official TypeScript SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients
repository.name: typescript-sdk

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to improve the error handling of invalid JSON-RPC requests in the SDK, specifically by returning error codes as specified in the JSON-RPC 2.0 spec.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The SDK should handle invalid JSON-RPC requests by returning specific error codes, as per the JSON-RPC 2.0 spec. This includes -32600 for malformed JSON-RPC and -32602 for bad parameters.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author mentions trying to implement validation logic in their application code but is unable to do so because invalid RPC requests never reach the handler. Claude suggests overriding the message handling to add validation, but the author does not like this approach.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to JSON-RPC 2.0 spec compliance, and the SDK should handle invalid JSON-RPC requests by returning specific error codes, such as -32600 for malformed JSON-RPC and -32602 for bad parameters. The author suggests writing a PR to implement this validation in the SDK.

issueDTO.title: Beads Explorer Small/Medium View: Replace Horizontal Tabs with Dropdown
issueDTO.description: **Description:** In the mobile or medium screens view of the Beads Explorer section, the tab bar (Bead Explorer / Network Trends / Rewards / Pool Dominance) looks cramped and misaligned. It takes too much vertical space, especially on narrow screens. And clicking on Network trends adds more noise to the same. **Proposed Improvement (open to more ideas):** 1. issueDTO.title: ???Feature: Implement Dark Mode Toggle in Settings
issueDTO.description:
### 🌙 Feature Request: Implement Dark Mode Toggle in Settings

**Summary**  
Add support for a dark mode theme that users can enable or disable through the Settings screen. The selected theme should persist between sessions.

---

**User Story**  
As a user, I want to enable dark mode from the Settings screen so I can use the site with a darker color scheme that is easier on my eyes, especially in low-light environments.

---

**Acceptance Criteria**  
- [ ] A ???Dark Mode??? toggle or switch is available in the Settings screen.  
- [ ] Switching themes updates the UI immediately without requiring a page reload.  
- [ ] User???s theme preference is saved in user profile and applied automatically on next visit.  
- [ ] All components and pages are styled correctly in both light and dark modes.  
- [ ] Follow brand color palette adjustments to ensure accessibility and sufficient contrast in dark mode.

---

**Tech Notes**  
- Integrate MUI???s theming system with a light/dark mode toggle.  
- Store theme preference in local storage for guest users, and in the user profile for logged-in users.

issueDTO.title: feat: timeoutSec for steps
issueDTO.description:
Hello again (https://github.com/dagu-org/dagu/issues/841)

thank you for writing and sharing this very cool software.

I noticed that an entire workflow can have timeoutSec, but not individual steps.

It makes perfect sense that you wouldn't want people being over-involved for the general use-case, but if my timeoutSec is an hourly task, I might also need to start time-boxing individual aspects of a workflow run, so that my feedback cycles are not too long, and it doesn't start to affect my productivity.
comments: I second this requirement. We also have a similar use case
I think it's basically a timeout with a select, and the code might be copy-able. Do you feel like we could PoC it in a PR and maintain it between us @ghansham ?
I think the logic that we have applied at dag level has to be called for step if we have thevtimeouSec property set for that step. We can do a POC for sure. Let's do it.
I think http request at step level have this feature implemented. We can replicate that logic at step level
@Lewiscowles1986 @ghansham  Thanks for the great suggestion! Adding `timeout` as a step field shouldn't be too difficult, and it might come in handy. I'll go ahead and support it soonish!
Is this implemented?
No I don't think so.
I Remember looking at this and realising it was less easy to shift as at the time (february) there was nothing selecting in a step that I could add a timer check to.

Hey @SiwonP I got this far, but the bit that was missing is that steps come under the parent, which has the ability to do more than one thing. Without wrapping every step with something checking the time against some time-source instantiated at the beginning of the instantiation of the step, I dont see how you could use the values to kill the step. Even if you did, you'd need to change the model of what a step is, at least from my read, they are synchronous blocks.
Just additional information, at dag level timeout is implemented if that is helpful in some way.

summary.attemptedFixes: The commenter @ghansham suggested a proof-of-concept (PoC) in a PR and maintaining it between them. @Lewiscowles1986 agreed to support the feature soonish. @yottahmd and @Lewiscowles1986 looked into the implementation but found it less easy than expected due to the complexity of the codebase.

The implementation involves using the 'StartedAt' time from NodeState struct and wrapping steps with a time-checking mechanism.

comments: Pinging @elastic/kibana-core (Team:Core)

Hi @TinaHeiligers 👋,

I???ve gone through the issue and fully understand the problem.  
The current use of `// @ts-expect-error` in the Saved Objects repository weakens type safety, and I agree that replacing it with a proper **type guard** is the right approach.

---

### 💡 My Approach
I plan to:
1. Identify all instances where `@ts-expect-error` is used (mainly around `MultiGetHit._source`).
2. Implement a type guard like:

   ```ts
   export function isGetGetResult<TDocument = unknown>(
     item: MgetResponseItem<TDocument>
   ): item is GetGetResult<TDocument> {
     return (item as MgetMultiGetError).error === undefined;
   }
3. Refactor the existing logic to use this type guard instead of @ts-expect-error.
4. Run tsc and related tests to ensure everything compiles and works correctly.

---

Would you please assign this issue to me?
I???d love to work on it and submit a PR with the fix.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Console logs in Cloudflare Store
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the Bug

When using the Cloudflare store, `console.log` is used to write question + response to the log. Should this perhaps have used the `logger` instead? There doesn't seem to be a way to skip this logging.

I refer to the console logs found here fx: https://github.com/mastra-ai/mastra/blob/main/stores/cloudflare/src/storage/domains/memory/index.ts#L522

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Use the Cloudflare store as storage.
2. Ask a question and see that the question+answer are logged to the console.

### Expected Behavior

Either log this when the developer wants a more verbose log or not logging at all.

### Environment Information

@mastra/cloudflare": "0.11.7

### Verification

- [x] I have searched the existing issues to make sure this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have included sufficient information for the team to reproduce and understand the issue
comments:
Hi! @wardpeet  I can take this.

### Proposal
Replace all `console.log` usage in the Cloudflare memory store with Mastra???s logger and avoid logging raw message bodies.

### Planned changes
- Swap `console.log(...)` with `this.logger?.debug(...)` so logs are suppressible.
- Add a helper to **summarize** message content (type/length/keys only) instead of dumping raw data, to prevent PII leakage.
- Guard existing `this.logger.error(...)` calls with optional chaining to avoid crashes when no logger is bound.
- No changes to storage logic, this only affects observability. 👍🏻

### Tests
To keep scope limited to this fix, I???ll add a targeted unit test for `MemoryStorageCloudflare`:
- **Unit**: stub `this.logger.debug` and assert it???s called with summaries (not raw content).
- **Unit**: verify no `console.log` remains.
- **Smoke**: save/get flow with logger at `info` (no debug output) and at `debug` (summary lines appear).

### Questions
- Preferred log level for these diagnostics? (Defaulting to **debug**).
- Any naming preference for the content-summary helper?

If this approach looks good, I???ll open a PR with the patch and tests.
yes sir

What's the update?
Should i do this?
im on it
will create a pr eod

Code sample ``` import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp( MaterialApp( home: Scaffold( body: const TabBar( tabs: [ Tab(text: 'Hello', child: Text('World')), ], ), ), ), ); } ```

issueDTO.title: El Juguete Perdido: Visual issues when using aspect ratios other than 16:9
issueDTO.description:
When playing the **El Juguete Perdido** scenes located at  
`res://scenes/quests/story_quests/el_juguete_perdido/` with an aspect ratio different from **16:9** (for example, *21:9* or *4:3*), some backgrounds and decorations appear outside the intended playable area.

Affected scenes: `0_intro/intro.tscn`, `2_combat/combat.tscn`, `3_sequence_puzzle/sequence_puzzle.tscn`, `4_outro/outro.tscn`

---

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the project in **Godot**.  
2. Enable **Debug Aspect Ratio** in *Project Settings*.  
3. Play each of the listed scenes.  
4. Resize the game window (e.g., *21:9* or *4:3*).  
5. Check if any background or decorative elements appear outside the visible area.

### Expected Result
Visual elements should adapt correctly without showing empty zones or areas outside the intended design.

> [!NOTE]  
> - **Debug Aspect Ratio:** Enabled for testing.  
> - **Related issue: #1083 

reference image of the issue:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0da42c96-ba38-4398-9501-dae9af431ef6)
comments:
> [!NOTE] 
> To recreate a **21:9** screen for testing, I used a smaller pixel size of `2560 x 1080` and scaled it down to `1900 x 801`. You can use these numbers as a reference for testing.  
> For **4:3** screens, you can use the pixel dimension `800 x 600`.  
> 
> These dimensions are just a reference for testing and help simulate wide aspect ratios without needing very large screens.  
> You can also try other aspect ratios (16:10, 16:9, etc.) to ensure visual consistency.

issueDTO.title: Keep track of how torrents are uploaded
issueDTO.description:
Add a new attribute `upload_method` in the `torrents` table which would be an eum and will store how the torrent has been uploaded.

By default it would be `manual` (for manual upload from the web interface). Upload tools should then either use an http header or set this value to their name. This way, we can keep track of how users upload to the site
comments: claiming this @FrenchGithubUser
@parnexcodes are you still interested on this or should I do it ? :)

repository.description: Content-agnostic torrent site & tracker framework
repository.name: arcadia

summary.main: Add a new attribute in the `torrents` table to track how torrents are uploaded, with default value for manual uploads from the web interface and allow upload tools to set their name.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Add a new attribute `upload_method` in the `torrents` table, with default value `manual`.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned.
summary.otherNotes: Claimed by FrenchGithubUser, comments from @FrenchGithubUser and @parnexcodes.

issueDTO.title: GitLab sign-in for private repository fails with "Unexpected sign in error, please try again"
issueDTO.description: **Describe the bug** Signing in to GitLab with a private repository URL at https://organice.200ok.ch/sign_in fails with the message "Unexpected sign in error, please try again". This persists after clearing site data. I'm able to reproduce this in Chrome on Linux (NixOS) and on Android. I can't reproduce this with Firefox, so it may be Chrome-specific. **To Reproduce** 1. In Chrome, go to https://organice.200ok.ch/sign_in 2. Attempt to sign in to GitLab, giving the URL of a private repository 3. Sign-in fails with a popup showing "Unexpected sign in error, please try again" (see screenshot) **Expected behavior** Clicking "Sign-in" should not produce an error and should redirect to a GitLab login page. **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: Linux (NixOS) - Browser: Chrome **Smartphone (please complete the following information):** - Device: Pixel 8 Pro - OS: Android 16 - Browser Stock browser (Chrome)
comments: did you invoke the console to get a more informative error message? (see my similar issue for a nextcloud instance #1058)

> did you invoke the console to get a more informative error message? (see my similar issue for a nextcloud instance https://github.com/200ok-ch/organice/issues/1058) I did try, but nothing is logged in the console: I also tried running a local server in debugging mode with `yarn start`. The issue persists, but the behavior is slightly different: on the first attempt, an error flashes up briefly in the console but it is cleared when the alert containing the error message appears; when I try a second time, the following error is shown in the console:
Full error trace ``` index.js:759 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'digest') at OAuth2AuthCodePKCE.generatePKCECodes (index.js:759:14) at OAuth2AuthCodePKCE. (react-dom.development.js:2170:10) at dispatchInteractiveEvent (react-dom.development.js:4882:3) OAuth2AuthCodePKCE.generatePKCECodes @ index.js:759 (anonymous) @ index.js:430 step @ index.js:60 interactiveUpdates @ react-dom.development.js:2170 dispatchInteractiveEvent @ react-dom.development.js:4882 ```

I seem to have found a workaround for the issue (though I don't understand the underlying cause): 0. Clear site data for https://organice.200ok.ch/ 1. Follow the reproduction steps above (you'll see the error alert) 2. Open Chrome dev tools, go to the network tab 3. Try to sign in again. Nothing will happen in the app, but a new request will show up to GitLab's `oauth/authorize` endpoint (see screenshot). The request has `Status: (canceled)`. 4. Double-click the cancelled request. This successfully redirects to the GitLab login, and upon successful authentication, organice is working.
I am getting the same error as described, but on mobile, with no devtools workaround.

Thank you for the bug report. There's multiple things being discussed in this issue:

1. Logging in with Gitlab as an Oauth provider using organice.200ok.ch
2. Logging in with Gitlab as an Oauth provider using a local instance

Those are separate, because you need credentials for setting up any OAuth backend. If you want to use Gitlab in your own instance, including a local instance, here's the relevant documentation: https://organice.200ok.ch/documentation.html#gitlab

As for option 1: I just tried it myself and _cannot_ reproduce the issue. I tried logging in multiple times from a fresh browser and each time, it worked fine. Here's a screen recording of the latest try: 

<video src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c91f5709-739c-4a00-be1d-4befcda1fa71?dl=1"></video>

Unfortunately, I don't see any logging options in Gitlab to debug anything related to OAuth. The _only_ metric Gitlab shows me is the number of clients which is well into the four digits. And, for every additional login, that I've made, that number has increased by one.

Additionally, if I wait long enough, I'll see that number increase even though I didn't do anything. That leads me to suspect that other people successfully use Gitlab as OAuth provider on organice.200ok.ch

After some more thought, I think your screenshot yields a potential answer! You get a `cancelled for the request to `/authorized`. . This usually happens before any network data is exchanged, so it???s not a server error but a client-side interruption. Could you try with a browser without any plugins and customizations?

> Could you try with a browser without any plugins and customizations?

I can still reproduce this running without extensions (using `chromium-browser --disable-extensions`). FWIW, `chromium-browser --version` shows `Chromium 142.0.7444.59`.

Also (like @dtvillafana) I can reproduce on mobile (Chrome on Android), where it's a bit more of a problem because the devtools workaround is not available.

While investigating this further, I noticed that while PKCE is used for GitLab OAuth, the request still [includes `clientSecret` as a request param](https://github.com/200ok-ch/organice/blob/ddd71529f13d12dbd73b159c802c93c6026316ab/src/sync_backend_clients/gitlab_sync_backend_client.js#L22) (also verified that it is present in the request URL in the deployed version).

I'm not an expert in OAuth/PKCE and haven't been able to follow the code well enough to understand if this is a real security issue or just a red herring, but seemed worth raising.

Apologies, I should have added more context.
I had been successfully using Organice with Gitlab as the Sync backend, but I eventually got logged out on my phone, and it has not been working (due to above error) for the last 2 weeks at the very least.
On my phone, I had been using:
Brave 1.84.133, Chromium 142.0.7444.53 on Android 16; Build/BP2A.250605.031.A3
But I was also able to reproduce the bug on Linux desktop (NixOS 25.05) with Brave Browser 1.84.135, Chromium 142.1.84.135

When using Brave, I turned off "Brave Shields" for Organice, so I'd like to think that decreased the likelihood this is a Brave specific error, and is rather a Chromium error.

Likely related to what was mentioned by @mcwitt , I get the following error in the console:
index.js:759 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'digest')
    at e.generatePKCECodes (index.js:759:14)
    at e.<anonymous> (index.js:430:34)
    at u (index.js:60:23)
    at Object.next (index.js:41:53)
    at index.js:35:71
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at $ed60001202da65be$var$__awaiter (index.js:31:12)
    at e.fetchAuthorizationCode (index.js:422:16)
    at o (index.js:120:27)
    at Object.s (react-dom.production.min.js:14:428)

which means it might have to do with this [backend sync file](https://github.com/200ok-ch/organice/blob/master/src/sync_backend_clients/gitlab_sync_backend_client.js) but I am not a JS dev, so take that with a grain of salt.

I am using the public Gitlab instance :)
I deployed Organice from the latest commit on master to a nixos box.
I can share a basic flake for the app build if you'd like.

Ok, so I did some additional investigation. Signing in to Gitlab works for these browser/os combinations:

- Firefox 144 / Debian Sid
- Chrome 137 / Debian Sid
- Safari / iOS 18.6.2

It does not work in Chrome 141 on Debian.

So, it does look quite likely that this is a recent Chrome related issue. I didn't realize that before. Mainly, because Firefox is my primary driver and secondly, because Chrome recently disabled web extensions v2 which in turn made good extensions impossible to use.

So, personally one day after that happened, I opted to lock Chrome to the last unbroken version like so:

```
  flatpak update --commit=87e924cf2b4809a25ed5fc099d44747c252d0dc3dac301ff17107f03134abe8b com.google.Chrome
  flatpak run --command=sh com.google.Chrome -c 'rm -rf
  ~/.var/app/com.google.Chrome'

  1. chrome:://flags
     - disable all manifest warnings
     - enable 'legacy' manifest
  2. chrome://extensions
     - go to ublock origin github release page
     - download the latest release
     - load unpacked extension
```

Having said all that, I'm of course in favor of finding out if we can re-enable Gitlab sign-in for current versions of Chrome. I don't have a solution for that, yet. In the meantime, at least you have the option of using another browser for organice.

Would anyone be open to work on finding out what changed in Chrome and provide a fix?
https://github.com/200ok-ch/organice/pull/1061 fixes the issue for me locally. @dtvillafana are you able to confirm? (edit: or @munen , I missed that you have a repro now too)

I can confirm that with #1061 I no longer get the "Unexpected sign in error, please try again" error, however, when clicking the Sign-in button for Gitlab, I still get the same PCKECodes error logged to console that I noted before, and Gitlab will still not sign in.

``` JS
index.js:759 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'digest')
    at e.generatePKCECodes (index.js:759:14)
    at e.<anonymous> (index.js:430:34)
    at u (index.js:60:23)
    at Object.next (index.js:41:53)
    at index.js:35:71
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at $06cc4c14b892ef52$var$__awaiter (index.js:31:12)
    at e.fetchAuthorizationCode (index.js:422:16)
    at o (index.js:121:27)
    at Object.s (react-dom.production.min.js:14:428)
```

@dtvillafana could you try clearing local storage for the app if you haven't already? (e.g. in the devtools "Application" tab, right-click and "Clear"). I found that the bug left some corrupted state and I wasn't able to sign in again until I did this.

@dtvillafana looking more closely at the error trace you posted, this actually looks like a different (and I think unrelated) error that I also hit while trying to debug the main issue.

In my case, I get that error when running the server locally and accessing it via http://0.0.0.0:3000 (i.e. the binding address printed to the console by `yarn start`). When I instead access http://localhost:3000, I do not get the error and sign-in works for me on the PR branch.

Digging into this a bit more, I think it has to do with the crypto API being unavailable in [insecure contexts](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Secure_Contexts) (the actual source of the error appears to be the line containing `return crypto.subtle.digest('SHA-256', new TextEncoder().encode(codeVerifier))` in the library code).

Assuming this is also your issue, would you be able to try http://localhost:3000 with and without the diff in #1061 ? (and also starting with fresh local storage; ugh, this is a messy issue)

summary.main: The issue is related to the GitLab sign-in feature in the application. The feature is not working correctly in Chrome browser and is resulting in an error message. The issue is specific to Chrome browser and its version.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is specific to Chrome browser and its version. The application should be tested in different browsers to ensure that it works correctly.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author of the issue has tried different approaches to resolve the issue, including clearing local storage, session storage, and cookies, but the issue persists. The author has also tried using a different browser and accessing the application via http://localhost:3000 instead of http://0.0.0.0:3000.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to Chrome browser and its version. It seems that the error is specific to Chrome and not reproducible in other browsers like Firefox. The issue is also related to the PKCE codes and the client secret being sent in the request. The author of the issue has tried different approaches to resolve the issue, including clearing local storage, session storage, and cookies, but the issue persists. The issue is also related to the OAuth flow and the way it is implemented in the application.

issueDTO.title: El Juguete Perdido ??? Combat: Visual issues when using aspect ratios other than 16:9
issueDTO.description:
In the scene `2_combat/combat.tscn`, some backgrounds or decorative elements appear outside the visible playable area when using aspect ratios other than 16:9.

### Quick Steps
1. Open the scene in **Godot**.  
2. Enable **Debug Aspect Ratio**.  
3. Change the window aspect ratio (e.g., 21:9 or 4:3) and check for elements out of place.

> [!NOTE]  
> - Sub-issue of main issue **El Juguete Perdido: Visual issues when using aspect ratios other than 16:9 #1549**  
> - Scene path: `res://scenes/quests/story_quests/el_juguete_perdido/2_combat/combat.tscn`
comments:

issueDTO.title: Cannot change values of numeric fields with percentage format
issueDTO.description:
### Bug type

Component

### Component name

MudNumericField

### What happened?

When using for example `Format="P2"`, the value is properly shown as e.g. `2.51%` but changing the value seems impossible, either by typing it or by using the up and down arrows

### Expected behavior

We should be able to type (0.00251 or 2.51%) or to use the up/down arrows.

### Reproduction link

https://try.mudblazor.com/snippet/GOcdOqlTREoRMWiT

### Reproduction steps

See the attached reproduction link using 
`<MudNumericField @bind-Value=@Value Format="P2" Step="0.01" />`


### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Version (bug)

6.4.1

### Version (working)

_No response_

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### On what operating system are you experiencing the issue?

Windows

### Pull Request

- [ ] I would like to do a Pull Request

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments: Is there a workaround for this?  Out app using a lot of percentages, so this is causing some headaches.

This issue has been marked as stale due to inactivity.  
If you have any updates or additional information, please comment below.

If no response is received, it will be automatically closed.

<!--
**Issue Analysis & Action Plan**

That's definitely a bug ??? it's broken functionality.  They've even provided a handy `try.mudblazor.com` snippet to reproduce it, which is ideal.  The code itself seems to be the culprit. The workaround already suggested appears to be really clear. Someone's given a custom `Converter<T>` and even a potential fix in `DefaultConverter<T>`, so that's a huge help.
The context is that it's been around for a while ??? June 2023. A maintainer removed the triage label back in May, meaning they saw it, but nothing has happened yet.  It's not assigned, but there is a clear community interest in this. The original author isn't a maintainer, which is fine, and there's 6 reactions and some decent comments.
From my perspective, this is a clear `bug`. The "good first issue" label seems spot on, since there's a good reproduction and the workaround clearly shows where the problem is. Now, given that the last human activity (a cross-reference) was way back in April 2024, and it's October 2025, it's also meeting the `stale` criteria for bugs.  The issue has been inactive for a long time. There's no reason to hold off, and no other special circumstances.
So, the plan is to tag it as `stale` to get the ball rolling, hopefully getting someone's attention. issueDTO.title: Mark packages as typed
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

Mypy is failing because the packages aren't marked as typed (missing `py.typed` file), but it seems that most of the packages have the type definitions.

Could the packages be marked as typed ?

**To Reproduce**

```python
from testcontainers.compose import DockerCompose

with DockerCompose("."):
  pass
```

```
$ mypy tests
tests/e2e_test.py:12: error: Skipping analyzing "testcontainers.compose": module is installed, but missing library stubs or py.typed marker  [import]
tests/e2e_test.py:12: note: See https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/running_mypy.html#missing-imports

```
comments: Yes, that should definitely be possible. Would you be up for setting up a PR? We could also add mypy checks in the same PR.
@jooola if you have any feedback about #504 it is welcome!

Does anyone know off hand whether this one was ever resolved?

I'm kind of a Python noob and was trying to add type checking on a project's tests. I got almost all of it working, except for testcontainers:

```
tests/conftest.py:5: error: Skipping analyzing "testcontainers.postgres": module is installed, but missing library stubs or py.typed marker  [import-untyped]
```

Looking in the file I'm using, it is typed, but I think the problem is that it's not declaring itself as such. Fixing this might be as simple as adding a `py.typed` file to the project.

there is a pr here but its not a top priority: #504 - almost immediately after i opened there were two pr's with minor typing fixes that conflicted with it, and i did not rebase in time. at this point it would be not only harder to rebase but also there are new modules that need types/mypy checking.

contributions would be accepted for it.

Thanks. My Python skills are such that I'm already having enough trouble just wrangling types in one much smaller package so I don't think I'll try my hand at this yet, but it's good to know I'm not missing something.

In case this helps anyone else, here's a block that can be placed in `mypy.ini` to flag it as ignored so that MyPy can pass for everything else:

``` ini
# testcontainers is typed, but it doesn't correctly declare itself as such.
# Hopefully it can be fixed one day:
#
# https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-python/issues/305
[mypy-testcontainers.*]
ignore_missing_imports = True
```
Has there been any update on this issue? It's been close to a year since the last comment
It looks like the relevant PR is https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-python/pull/810

I attempted to resolve this with https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-python/pull/918

I tested this PR locally by doing the following:
1. I forked the testcontainers repo and cloned it locally
2. In my working repo that is using testcontainers, I changed the dependency in pyproject.toml to not point to a release version but to instead point to a local directry. I did something like:
`uv pip install --editable "file:///Users/username/open-source/testcontainers-python[postgres]"`
3. Type checker validation:  Executed Pyright against all the code in my directory
```
  pyright .
  0 errors, 0 warnings, 0 informations
```

repository.description: Testcontainers is a Python library that providing a friendly API to run Docker container. It is designed to create runtime environment to use during your automatic tests.
repository.name: testcontainers-python

summary.main: Mark packages as typed, specifically testcontainers, due to mypy failing due to missing py.typed file.

issueDTO.title: [BUG]: Acceptance test re-run steps do not work due to server not being shut down
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

In https://github.com/oppia/oppia/actions/runs/19214738289/job/54922681671, an acceptance test failed in the first desktop run. The end of the log looks like this:

```
Ran all test suites matching /core\/tests\/puppeteer-acceptance-tests\/specs\/translation-reviewer\/filter-the-translations.spec.ts/i.
Jest did not exit one second after the test run has completed.

This usually means that there are asynchronous operations that weren't stopped in your tests. Consider running Jest with `--detectOpenHandles` to troubleshoot this issue.
```

In the subsequent reruns (desktop to check for flakiness, mobile, and mobile a second time), the reruns gave no useful info because the tests could not start. A representative log (emphasis mine):

```
Notice:  A new release of pip is available: 25.2 -> 25.3
Notice:  To update, run: pip install --upgrade pip
Everything up-to-date
/home/runner/work/oppia/oppia/scripts/install_python_prod_dependencies.py:30: UserWarning: pkg_resources is deprecated as an API. See https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html. The pkg_resources package is slated for removal as early as 2025-11-30. Refrain from using this package or pin to Setuptools<81.
  import pkg_resources

            Oppia server is already running. Try shutting all the servers down
            before running the script.
        
Printing diff in requirements_dev.in:
--------------------------
--------------------------
Starting new Portserver: python -m scripts.run_portserver --portserver_unix_socket_address /home/runner/work/oppia/oppia/portserver.socket
**There is already a server running on localhost:8181. Please terminate it before running the end-to-end tests.**
Exiting.
Stopping Portserver(pid=4983)...
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
##[debug]Finishing: Re-run Desktop Acceptance Test to check flakiness for translation-reviewer/filter-the-translations
```



### URL of the page where the issue is observed.

N/A

### Steps To Reproduce

Force a failure due to timeout in a desktop acceptance test, then run the CI suite for that test and watch the rerun fail.

### Expected Behavior

The test reruns should start from a clean slate and not be blocked by the server already running.

### Screenshots/Videos

_No response_

### What device are you using?

Desktop

### Operating System

Linux

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

### Browser version

_No response_

### Additional context

Suggested fix: before any rerun, ensure that the server is fully shut down.

Related: Find a way to handle the error "Jest did not exit one second after the test run has completed. This usually means that there are asynchronous operations that weren't stopped in your tests. Consider running Jest with `--detectOpenHandles` to troubleshoot this issue."

### Tips for developers

Before addressing the bug, please identify which PR caused the issue (you can follow the steps [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/How-to-find-the-commit-which-introduced-a-bug)). If you identify the PR, comment on the issue with a link to it. If not, mention the commit hash of the oldest commit you saw the bug on (and the month and year it was made in).

Then, please leave a comment with details of the approach that you plan to take to fix the issue (see [example](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/19157#issuecomment-1858788463)).

**Note:** If this is your first Oppia issue, please make sure to follow our guidelines for [choosing an issue](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue) and [setting things up](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#setting-things-up). You will also need to show a demo of the fix working correctly on your local machine. Thanks!

issueDTO.title: InkDrinker_3: Camera bounds show areas outside the scene when using aspect ratios other than 16:9
issueDTO.description:
### Problem Description
When playing the **InkDrinker 3** level (*scene: `ink_combat_round_3`*) with an aspect ratio different from **16:9** (for example, *21:9* or *4:3*), the camera bounds allow parts of the scene to be visible that were not meant to be seen.  
This happens when the game window expands horizontally or vertically, exposing areas outside the region "dressed" by the level designer.


### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the project in the **Godot** editor.  
2. In **Project Settings**, enable **Debug Aspect Ratio**.  
3. Start the level **InkDrinker 3** (*scene: `ink_combat_round_3`*).  
4. Resize the window (for example, make it wider or taller).  
5. Observe that the camera shows undesigned or empty areas outside the intended playable region.


### Expected Result
The camera should remain within the designed playable area and not display regions outside the intended environment.

---

### Suggested Fix
This issue could be resolved by **adding more decoration (e.g., water)** around the edges of the scene and **adjusting the camera limits** so that the view stays centered on the action.  

>[!NOTE]
>- Found while testing the main issue #1083 .
>- Scene path: `res://scenes/quests/lore_quests/quest_001/2_ink_combat/ink_combat_round_3.tscn`
comments: Adjust the camera limits so that the view remains centered. Currently, the visible tiles are **19 horizontally** and **11 vertically**, so the approximate bounds should be: - Right limit: `19 * 64` - Bottom limit: `11 * 64`

issueDTO.title: Improve `__pow__` for `SingleQubitCliffordGate` and `CliffordGate` class
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a use case or problem? Please describe.**
The `__pow__` operator for `CliffordGate` is implemented only for integer powers and has complexity $\mathcal{O}(n)$ where $n$ is the exponent.
https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/ec84a057614396bf89459cd141a5f77b4d01ed48/cirq-core/cirq/ops/clifford_gate.py#L399-L411

For  `SingleQubitCliffordGate` it's implemented for only integer powers where it falls to `CliffordGate.__pow__` and for $\pm \sqrt{}$.
https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/ec84a057614396bf89459cd141a5f77b4d01ed48/cirq-core/cirq/ops/clifford_gate.py#L718-L728

**Describe the solution you'd like**
For `CliffordGate.__pow__` exponentiation should be done using [binary exponentiation](https://cp-algorithms.com/algebra/binary-exp.html) to reduce the complexity ot $\mathcal{O}(\log{n})$. Support for non integer exponents is hard in the general case.

For `SingleQubitCliffordGate.__pow__`. The single qubit clifford gates are a group of size 24. see. https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/ec84a057614396bf89459cd141a5f77b4d01ed48/cirq-core/cirq/ops/clifford_gate.py#L149

support for integer powers can be done in $\mathcal{O}(1)$ if we either fall to the optimized `CliffordGate.__pow__` but with `exponent%24` instead of `expnent` or cache the results in table and access `group_powers[self][exponent%24]`. For rational exponents, When the clifford operation has a sqrt. The operation becomes well defined for exponents of the form $\frac{k}{2}$ where $k \in \mathbb{Z}$.  For example $X^\frac{5}{2}$ is the same as $SqrtX^5$ and $X^\frac{-5}{2}$ which is the same as $(SqrtX^\dagger)^5$.


**What is the urgency from your perspective for this issue? Is it blocking important work?**
<!-- Please choose one and remove the others -->

P3 - I'm not really blocked by it, it is an idea I'd like to discuss / suggestion based on principle

issueDTO.title: Drop uvicorn from test suite
issueDTO.description: We should be using `httpx.AsyncClient` with `httpx.ASGITransport`.
comments: could you pls give more insights on this , happy to work on this
The idea is to not have Uvicorn running on the test suite, it's to use the ASGITransport to "run as the server".
Ok got it thanks , it needs to be updated for all the applicable tests under folder named -> 'tests'. Could you please assign this task

@jeevakumar-m Any success with this issue? 

I'm running into `ResourceWarning: Unclosed <MemoryObjectReceiveStream at xxxxxx>` when testing `test_streamablehttp_client`-like functions in [test_streamable_http.py](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk/blob/main/tests/shared/test_streamable_http.py) with ASGITransport.

For the tests, I passed a client factory which returns `httpx.AsyncClient` wired with `httpx.ASGITransport` to `streamablehttp_client` _(referenced below)._

https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk/blob/679b22970e12b8eec3897108ac7d6b0624809b9e/src/mcp/client/streamable_http.py#L441-L449

Hello. I am a new contributor and picked up this issue as my first task.

I started implementing it and wanted to check if I have the right understanding.
ASGITransport works well for normal request/response tests, but it does not support streaming. It buffers until the application completes, so SSE, WebSockets, and other long-lived streams do not behave correctly. MCP relies on SSE and web socket functionality for testing, so those tests still appear to require a real server such as uvicorn.

I also tried `StreamingASGITransport` in `src/mcp/server/streaming_asgi_transport.py` [here](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk/blob/main/src/mcp/server/streaming_asgi_transport.py) for SSE tests, but I encountered resource and event loop cleanup issues (for example, resource busy and event loop closed errors). It does not currently seem like a drop-in replacement for uvicorn for streaming tests.


Before I continue, can you confirm whether the intended approach for this issue is:
* Use ASGITransport for standard HTTP tests
* Keep uvicorn for SSE and streaming tests
* Document why both are required and reference the upstream issues

I wanted to check that I am aligned with the intended direction before submitting a PR.
Thank you.
We should implement the transport on our side, if it can't handle stream. Uvicorn should be dropped from the test suite. Maybe a good first step is to actually implement that transport.
@Kludex Ok noted on this, thanks. I'll look into how to improve `StreamingASGITransport` so that it can be used as a drop in replacement for uvicorn in streaming tests.
