issueDTO.title: docs-bug(MatInput): How to nest / wrap material form controls
issueDTO.description:
#### Documentation Feedback

I find myself getting stuck on this again and again, and I've been using angular and material since it's inception, so by now it should have stuck up there in the old noggin, but alas.

Today we have a basic tutorial on how to do a completely custom form field
https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control

but there is no tutorials examples of how to take an existing matInput mat-select or other form controls and wrap them into a component.
Usually we need to do this to DRY things up and not have to have the same error messages, options or reoccurring fields multiple times. 

## These are some tutorials / examples I would like to see

**Custom component to wrap sub field names, validation and errors**
I have an Address FormGroup which contains
street, zipcode, city
and a couple of mat-form-fields with labels, inputs, errors
I now want to wrap this into a `<app-address-field formGroupName="customer.address" />`

**Custom `mat-select` with static list of values and validation**
I have a Language select that is reused in multiple places
I now want to use it `<app-lang-select formControlName="project.language" />`

**Custom `input with some kind of dialog picker`**
A User picker, should display the user name when done, and an icon to the right much like a date picker.
but then in the dialog we have some custom logic to list all users, and the value that comes out of the picker should be the database id for the user.
`<app-user-picker formControlName="client.salesPerson" />`



## The struggles
Since matInput already implements ControlValueAccessor it must be possible to just provide / delegate functionality down to that child, but how?

I have multiple implementations of the above, but all of them feel over complicated, or the dirty state isn't working because of something.

We need best practices for creating wrapped form controls and form groups :)

Please let me know if you need more context or examples, I have plenty
comments: @leon I would like to take a look at some examples, just out of curiosity

Documentation should also provide an example how a wrapper component should be designed in a `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` context, since the error state is updated during `ngDoCheck`, which isn't called when a component that wraps `mat-form-field` uses `OnPush` and isn't marked for checking.

From what I understand, [this solution](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/6266270b0f617446b8f8696a59d5539a59f53510/src/material/input/input.ts#L353-L358) only works if the input is either within the same view as the form, or if the change detection strategy is set to `Default`

_Since matInput already implements ControlValueAccessor it must be possible to just provide / delegate functionality down to that child, but how?_

Found myself with the same problem last week.
What I did:
On the wrapper component add an @Input() that receives the FormControl (I guess similar logic would apply for formgroup)
So the component would look like this:

<app-lang-select [control]="form.get('project.language')" />

And on the template 
<mat-select [formControl]="control">

This approach made my life so much easier, i was already going crazy with the unnecessary complexity my component had before. But i agree that we need some sort of directive that would remove the need to do this way.

I think I have the same problem:

Inside a `<mat-form-field />`, I have a custom component `<app-companies-select />` which contains `<mat-select matInput />`. 
but I still have the `mat-form-field must contain a MatFormFieldControl` error, because `mat-form-field` only checks for `MatFormFieldControl` in its direct children and not all descendants.

Bumped into my own problem yet again...

I found this old talk which goes over the problem some what.
but I still feel a material specific guide would be a good idea.

https://youtu.be/CD_t3m2WMM8?t=1522
Some working example if you need: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75850069/how-to-wrap-custom-angular-material-control-into-own-component

This particular problem is the reason I can not recommend to use angular material for any large scale project.

Custom material control is ridiculously complex when you need to wrap well known element like input. Even if done right still dies not solve all the problems since you probably want another wrapper around whole form-field stuff.

I have examples where I implemented all of the mentioned solutions like custom control value accessor or just passing the control inside a wrapping component.

Nothing works as a complete solid experience that whole form in single place gives you.
With above solutions you can defeat the mat-errrors and relations between form-field and input.
 But you will still loose relation with <form> so for instance submitting errored form will not highlight controls., because mat-form-fields are nit aware of dirtiness. You need some fancy custom error strategy or propagate the form state to each wrapping control yourself.

Controls and buttons are two main things require redesign to make material compatible in flexibility to any other design system solution out there in the market.
Clear guide is a bare minimum starting point here.
@atakchidi may I ask you what UI component library would you recommend instead of Angular material? Do you have an experience with something more flexible?

Bumped into this yet again, 3 years later. 😅

Could someone from the team please add a guide on how we can wrap a mat-select or mat-input and create a form control that works with form-fields.

I cannot be the only one who want to have custom form controls with reusable logic?
Not a perfect example, but I wrote something related to same issue couple of years back: https://blog.shhdharmen.me/creating-a-custom-form-field-control-group-using-angular-material

I've solved this problem by just injecting `NgControl` and lifting out `AbstractControl` from it through `ngControl.control`. If you pass that control down to the nested component, you do not need to reimplement `ControlValueAccessor` inside the wrapping component. The wrapped component will hook up its own `ControlValueAccessor` to the injected control.

It's a bit verbose, so at least in my projects, I've created a mixin `mixinPropagateFormControl` that I can use in components for any propagation (like `PasswordComponent` -> `InputComponent`).

repository.description: Component infrastructure and Material Design components for Angular
repository.name: components

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to create a best practice guide on how to create wrapped form controls and form groups using Angular Material, specifically for wrapping matInput, matSelect, and other form controls to reuse logic and reduce code duplication.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the creation of a custom form control that wraps around existing matInput, matSelect, or other form controls to reuse logic and reduce code duplication. The custom control should work with form-fields and be able to handle errors and validation.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has tried multiple approaches, including injecting NgControl and lifting out AbstractControl, but feels they are overcomplicated or don't work with ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush. Some users have also shared their own solutions, such as using a mixin to propagate the form control.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about creating a custom form control that wraps around existing matInput, matSelect, or other form controls to reuse logic and reduce code duplication. The author has tried multiple approaches but feels they are overcomplicated or don't work with ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush. The author is looking for a best practice guide on how to create wrapped form controls and form groups.

issueDTO.title: Add surrealdb storage
issueDTO.description:
Would be great if [surrealdb](https://surrealdb.com/) support can be added. It can run in memory, single node with file as well as distributed, has events support and is written in Rust.

SurrealDB in 100 Seconds gives a good overview.- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C7WFwgDRStM
comments: This can be considered for #12
as far as I know, even if surrealdb is written in Rust, the client library for rust has not been released yet. This means that you cannot connect to an external surrealdb instance
There is https://docs.rs/surrealdb/1.0.0-beta.8/surrealdb/
Not released yet but I would wait for the next version which has the new integrated APIs. https://github.com/surrealdb/surrealdb/pull/1514

Hey @geofmureithi I can look at this if there are no takers for this issue.

EDIT: I will be able to start working on it about three works for now.
Sure @itsyaasir You can take this task. Be sure to look at @prabirshrestha 's work https://github.com/prabirshrestha/mq
You should be able to just get it working by implementing ~`Storage`~ `MessageQueue`.
I will, thanks :)
Hello @itsyaasir any progress on this?
Hey @geofmureithi I would like to take up this issue.
Hey @realonbebeto Sure. I already have some work done [here](https://github.com/apalis-dev/apalis-surrealdb), I will share the repo. Meanwhile hope you have read the latest docs on `apalis-core`
I trust you mean these [docs](https://docs.rs/apalis/latest/apalis/prelude/index.html). Because that's what I have been looking at alongside the codebase.

No, not sure why you are looking at the prelude.

https://docs.rs/apalis-core/1.0.0-alpha.9/apalis_core/
Well, thank you. It's now clear what I'll use as my reference.
Take a look at https://github.com/apalis-dev/apalis-sqlite, you will possibly implement most of the same traits
Sure. I was initially looking at https://github.com/geofmureithi/apalis/tree/main/packages/apalis-sql and it seems there is a progression in structure.
@geofmureithi Following the earlier chats what are the next steps?

I think the most important thing is to figure out the best way to poll, the sqlite repo provided includes several poll implementations:
- Pull based (Lazy)
- Push based (Eager)
- Shared Pull with Push impl

I think surreal supports [live](https://surrealdb.com/docs/surrealql/statements/live) but I am not sure if thats the way forward.

Good catch. I like to think it can support the poll implementations you listed in addition to its postgres like feature(LISTEN/NOTIFY)  that is [live](https://surrealdb.com/docs/surrealql/statements/live), which you have mentioned.

You mentioned that you???ve already done some work ??? could it be made public yet?

@geofmureithi I???d be super excited to take this on and I???m ready whenever you are! Since you mentioned there???s already some work done, I???d love to pick up from there and keep things moving forward.

I will share the code hopefully tonight with the basic setup but here is the main part:
```rust
pub struct SurrealStorage<T> {
    consumer: mq_surreal::SurrealJobProcessor,
    producer: mq_surreal::SurrealProducer,
    _t: PhantomData<T>,
}

pub struct SurrealContext {
    kind: String,
    created_at: Option<OffsetDateTime>,
    updated_at: Option<OffsetDateTime>,
    last_result: Option<Value>,
    max_attempts: u16,
    lease_time: Duration,
    priority: u8,
    unique_key: Option<String>,
}
```
And the abstractions are built on top of [`mq`](https://github.com/prabirshrestha/mq) by @prabirshrestha. He should be able to answer questions about the inner workings on `mq`. Let me know what you think.

I have taken time to review [mq](https://github.com/prabirshrestha/mq) issues, and my reservation is that apalis-surrealdb should be developed from the ground up, drawing on all possible inspiration, but without mq as a dependency, since the author believes mq is in early-stage crate with minimal progression/development.

There is a pull request https://github.com/surrealdb/surrealdb/pull/1514. The author has some work done, but it's not public yet.

issueDTO.title: Add support for additional LLM and embedding providers
issueDTO.description:
## Description

The framework currently supports several LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama, watsonx.ai, ...), but there are many other important providers that would benefit the community. This issue is about identifying and implementing support for additional providers that are widely used but not yet supported.

## Task

1. Identify LLM provider(s) that we currently do not support but would add significant value to the framework if we did
2. Implement support for identified provider(s)
comments: Hi I'd like to contribute, can I take on this issue?
@LunkadV absolutely! let us know what providers you are looking to integrate
@jenna-winkler I can add support for Cloud Qwen models and DeepSeek models
Great @LunkadV . Go for it.
Hi I sent in a PR over the weekend, please let me know if anything needs tweaking

Great work on the PR ??? I really appreciate the effort you???ve put in! I initially thought the providers had their own special handling, but since they???re OpenAI-compatible, it seems we could use the OpenAIChatModel class directly. From what I can tell, there doesn???t appear to be a difference between the two approaches. Could you clarify what additional value this implementation provides?

Essentially it's just letting the ChatModel know what to search for in the .env for it's url and api_key, as well as setting a default model and letting the user call a ChatModel with the name of the provider they are using.

Since almost all the adapters are extending the LiteLLMChatModel if you wanted to reduce code, most of them code be removed and the LiteLLMChatModel can be set to search the env for a generic api key and base url. 

So I suppose it's a minor convenience to any user, if they are going to use a Qwen model they can create a QwenChatModel in their code instead of a generic ChatModel.

I see, therefore the DeepSeek provider is fine. 

But what about the `qwen` provider? I can't see such provider in the LiteLLM. I found only this https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/providers/dashscope. The implementation in #1281 uses `openai` and it does not even set the `base_url`. Either update it to the `dashscope ` or remove.

issueDTO.title: Add trick for accessing chart names inside Values with dashes to Best Practices documentation
issueDTO.description:
We have a pretty old issue https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/2192#issuecomment-892738573 that was closed, but no documentation is improved by it. So I decided to open a new issue to fix the documentation, because I spend a lot of time tinkering with "dash in chart name" problem before found that issue :(

Let's add to the page https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/values/ any note about restriction of dashes in variable names and the workaround using "index" function:
```yaml
{{ index .Values "gitlab-runner" "checkInterval" }}
```
Or maybe anybody can suggest a better place to describe this limitation and workaround?
comments:
transferred to helm-www.

Source: https://github.com/helm/helm-www/blob/main/content/en/docs/chart_best_practices/values.md
So we shouldnt be able to name chart with "-" ?

I'd love to see something here...

I had a line (from https://github.com/argoproj/argo-helm/blob/171177ab77f3e5b242566de5a3b8638c10a40928/charts/argo-cd/templates/argocd-repo-server/pdb.yaml#L8)
```helm
{{- include "argo-cd.labels" (dict "context" . "component" .Values.repoServer.name "name" .Values.repoServer.name) | nindent 4 }}
```

That's being used by a child chart `argo-cd` (`charts/argo-cd/...`).

I'd like to access it from my own template (`templates/...`).

I think in theory `.Values.repoServer.name` could be changed to `index .Values "argo-cd" "repoServer" "name"` but I can't actually figure out how to make the rest of the thing happy.

fwiw, this worked (but wasn't particularly obvious):

```helm
    {{- $repoServerName := index .Values "argo-cd" "repoServer" "name" -}}
    {{- include "argo-cd.labels" (dict "context" . "component" $repoServerName "name" $repoServerName) | nindent 4 }}
```
This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.
This would be a pretty easy change to the tips and tricks page maybe.

issueDTO.title: [Server] scrape for each Oauth2 Service Provider's Favicon
issueDTO.description:
# Problem statement
The list of available Oauth2 Providers is dynamic at runtime. The frontend is agnostic to the providers but should show the icon that's provided by the backed from the Oauth2Source. Some sites like Github make finding the favicon easy `https://github/favicon.ico` other sites its in a custom location. The header data on the html _usually_ has the data. 

## Technical requirements
- [ ] use Jsoup to search the header data for "rel=icon" in the header or other proposed area to extract the icon. 
  - Jsoup is used throughout the application to scrape the web. 
  - https://mkyong.com/java/jsoup-get-favicon-from-html-page/ (for ideas)
- [ ] Add this check to `oauth2Providers/` endpoint
  - https://github.com/R-Sandor/FindFirst/blob/a13147ff94a3248e10e1f480ff87ff200d72b4d8/server/src/main/java/dev/findfirst/users/controller/UserController.java#L90
- [ ] consider/purpose a way to cache the icon
  - Scrapping the same content over and over is not ideal maybe even a simple map after startup for lookup is good.
  - If it makes sense this can be the start of a WebUtil service.
- [ ] Add testing for new code coverage

issueDTO.title: Cannot specify validation period for days/months/years when generating tokens using kumactl
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

As parsing time.Duration works only with time periods (i.e `1m`, `24h`, `23h59m` etc.) you cannot specify period in days/months/years as we suggests in help/docs of our commands:
https://github.com/kumahq/kuma/blob/8708885a8ef244f0806aa7d5dae08c7dde64a7bb/app/kumactl/cmd/generate/generate_zoneingress_token.go#L29
we can fix it by changing flag description/help, but I think we should add possibility to provide values like `1d` or `1y` by using something like https://github.com/hako/durafmt or similar
comments:
@bartsmykla, I remember facing a similar issue while working on expanding the ca `expiration` field to include months and years also. I wrote a helper function `ParseDuration` inside the `mesh_helper` file. ref - https://github.com/tharun208/kuma/blob/master/pkg/core/resources/apis/mesh/mesh_helpers.go#L94.

I think this will help you. But there is a limitation with the above function as it won't support `23h59m`. If we are going with https://github.com/hako/durafmt  means, we can also change for `expiration` field on the mTLS.

issueDTO.title: Replace deprecated package `babel/plugin-proposal-private-property-in-object`
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

1. This package has been deprecated
2. This is not suitable for sustainable code

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Run the command `npm install`
2. Error occurs

**Expected behavior**


1. Run the command `npm install`
2. The error does not occur because the package has been suitably upgraded according to the recommendations of the organization that manages the package.
3. The application must continue to run
4. Feature functionality must be maintained


**Additional details**

- Error message on installation

```
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-private-property-in-object@7.21.11: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-private-property-in-object instead.

```

**Potential internship candidates**

Please read this if you are planning to apply for a Palisadoes Foundation internship 
- https://github.com/PalisadoesFoundation/talawa/issues/359

1. This package has been deprecated

**To Reproduce**

**Expected behavior**

1. Run the command `npm install`

issueDTO.title: Re-expose Storage Integration Tests
issueDTO.description:
Historically the integration tests for the storage layer have been exposed, and even [recommended](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/tree/main/internal/storage/v1/grpc#certifying-compliance) to be used to verify the correctness of 3rd party storage plugins. 

The documentation still recommends this, but the docs are stale, and with the recent refactoring where the integration suite was moved into internal, this is no longer possible.

The breaking changes happened in #6657, but are a part of the greater #6637
comments: @robbert229 do you have an external repo that is using the integration test suite before it was moved to internal?

Hey @robbert229 !!
I'm looking into fixing this issue and wanted to discuss possible solutions before making any changes. Since the integration tests were moved to internal/, I've few possible ways to  re-expose them.

1. Moving the integration tests back to a public pkg/, this will restores the original behavior making the tests accessible to external users again...
2. Creating a new public test utility package that wraps the internal tests which allows more controlled access while keeping internals hidden.
3. Providing a CLI tool or Docker Container for Integration testing, works for non Go users as well but requires additional setup. 
4. If exposing the tests isn't ideal, we could guide users on how to manually validate their storage plugins also this wouldn't fully restore the old behavior but might be an easier workaround.

Would love to hear your thoughts on which approach makes the most sense. Let me know what direction I should take!

I have a potentially different direction. Since the only way to implement 3rd party storage for jaeger is via grpc remote api, we don't actually need to expose any code, we only need to expose a test binary that will run the test against a provided grpc endpoint. This technically does not require any changes in jaeger because 3rd party can still clone the repo and run the test the same way we run it, just start their own remote storage.

Hey @yurishkuro , thanks for the clarification!

So instead of re-exposing the tests, external users can simply clone the Jaeger repo and run the test suite against their own gRPC storage backend???no changes needed in Jaeger itself.

Would this require any additional setup or documentation updates for third-party storage providers? Also, should we add a script to simplify running these tests, or is the current workflow sufficient?
Documentation wouldn't hurt, I don't recall what's currently documented. I don't think a script is needed, because integration tests can be run simply as `go test {path}`. It should be documented.

We're currently implementing a grpc storage plugin, and the approach with a tests helper function exposed from jaeger go package itself like before (used by jaeger-clickhouse and currently provided in the docs) would be much more convenient, as cloning external repos in a closed CI circuits is unsafe and unstable (e.g. reliant on network).

We have no plans to re-open the code to be importable, it was a lot of effort to break external dependencies from OTEL on Jaeger, which was never meant to be used as a library. There is an issue #7055 to update documentation. I still think the best bet for supporting external storage testing is to build a binary that will invoke the internal test code.

I believe the best way to provide tests is in the same way as the interface itself. Might be a good idea to extract the proto, codegen and test suite into a separate repo with an exported public package. https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-idl seems like a good fit.
It's not the best for the project, having tests in another repo is a lot more friction for regular development, can't even commit tests and behavior in the same PR.

issueDTO.title: Support compressed download in `database.rcsb.fetch()`
issueDTO.description: The RCSB PDB provides all files also in gzipped format. Therefore, to improve download times in `database.rcsb.fetch()`, one could optionally download the gzipped files and and unzip the HTTP response content via Python's `gzip` module, before writing the structure file to disk.
comments:
Hi!

I'm really keen to contribute to Biotite so I ran a few tests on this. It seems that the speed up for downloading gzipped files is fairly negligible when you account the time for required to unzip the file. The results were generated using repeat() from timeit with 10 runs and 100 repetitions (1000 repetitions in total) and are in the table below. You can find the test code [here](https://github.com/Orpowell/biotite/blob/gzip_pdb_download/src/biotite/database/rcsb/speed_comparison.py).

| download type | speed (s) |
| --- | --- |
| pdb | 5.02787 |
| gzipped pdb | 5.00965 |
| difference |  0.01822 |


There might be a way to eek-out more performance but I'm not sure how you'd do it. If you still think this is worth adding to the library - I'm happy to finish off the implementation. Let me know what you think!


Cheers,

Ollie

Thanks for the benchmark. I created a [modified version](https://gist.github.com/padix-key/975751d0f5b22c56835d19c25df6fdf2) of your script (larger structure, omitted writing step) and found similar results: The differences are marginal and which one is faster is not clear.

Still a compressed download probably makes sense, in case the bandwidth is limiting. I just would not use it as the default. So if you still like to implement this feature, feel free to do so :+1:.
Awesome I'll start working on it 👍.
Hi, are you still planning to implement this feature? If not, this is also fine, but I would free the issue up again.
Due to inactivity I assigned myself to this issue.

repository.description: A comprehensive library for computational molecular biology
repository.name: biotite

summary.main: Support compressed download in database.rcsb.fetch() to improve download times.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Optional download of gzipped files and unzip the HTTP response content via Python's gzip module, before writing the structure file to disk.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author ran a few tests on this and found similar results: The differences are marginal and which one is faster is not clear. A modified version of the script was also created.
summary.otherNotes: The RCSB PDB provides all files also in gzipped format. The speed up for downloading gzipped files is fairly negligible when you account the time for required to unzip the file.

issueDTO.title: Infineon XMC4700 : I2C not functional
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

I2C is not functional on the Infineon XMC4700 relax kit. 

**Diagnose:** 
When using the default I2C settings (coming from the board's devicetree), we get the following error: 
```bash
[00:00:05.436,000] <err> i2c_infineon_xmc4: Invalid I2C bit rate value          
[00:00:05.436,000] <err> i2c_infineon_xmc4: Unsupported speed 
```
If `clock-frequency` is set (in a DT overlay for example), then I2C is functional.

**Regression:**
I did not run a git bisect; but based on the commit log of the i2c_ifx_xmc4.c driver, the faulty commit is:
commit 16c40b16f3ffbc2cabb8d43f8824840aecaa95da . This is a (long standing) regression.


### Regression

- [x] This is a regression, but it only impacts the Infineon XMC4 boards.

### Steps to reproduce

1. enable I2C shell with a hello world for instance. 
2. run an i2c scan: 
```bash
i2c scan usic48020200 
```

### Relevant log output

```shell
[00:00:05.436,000] <err> i2c_infineon_xmc4: Invalid I2C bit rate value          
[00:00:05.436,000] <err> i2c_infineon_xmc4: Unsupported speed
```

### Impact

Annoyance ??? Minor irritation; no significant impact on usability or functionality.

### Environment

Host OS: Linux/Fedora
Zephyr: v4.2
Toolchain: 0.17.4 

Problem is present since Zephyr v3.5.

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments:
This is a good first issue. 
It is a simple bug (the fix itself is 5 characters long!). This can be a good exercise however, if you want to test  your understanding about devicetree / bindings and driver registration. Ping me, if you're interested.
Hi, I would like to try and solve this, I'll work on it soon, will I need the kit to test ?

Hi @yassine-safraoui ,

no kit is needed. This can be resolved solely looking at the code (!)
But I have one on my desk, so can do the testing. 
Of course if you can get easily your hand on such a kit, it's also great. 

Here some hints for the investigation:
- where does the error coming from?
- where is the bitrate initialized?
- problem occurs when clock-frequency (property of I2C controller) is not explicitly set. 
- Check the default value set for bitrate when clock-frequency is not set / double check is the i2c controller binding file the expectation fro clock-frequency.
- submit a PR

Hope this helps!

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to make I2C functional on the Infineon XMC4700 relax kit by setting the clock-frequency property of the I2C controller.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The I2C bit rate value must be set explicitly, and the clock-frequency property of the I2C controller must be set to make I2C functional.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author mentioned that the fix is 5 characters long, but it's not specified what the fix is.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is a regression, impacting only Infineon XMC4 boards, and has been present since Zephyr v3.5. The problem can be resolved by setting the clock-frequency property of the I2C controller.

Unlike many shuffles (inc PALIGNR) - these are act across the full vector width - review CodeGenFunction::EmitX86BuiltinExpr to see how they can be implemented - should still be able to use a interp__builtin_ia32_shuffle_generic/evalShuffleGeneric callback however

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

```
__m512i _mm512_alignr_epi64 (__m512i a, __m512i b, const int imm8)
__m512i _mm512_mask_alignr_epi64 (__m512i src, __mmask8 k, __m512i a, __m512i b, const int imm8)
__m512i _mm512_maskz_alignr_epi64 (__mmask8 k, __m512i a, __m512i b, const int imm8)
```
Unlike many shuffles (inc PALIGNR) - these are act across the full vector width - review CodeGenFunction::EmitX86BuiltinExpr to see how they can be implemented - should still be able to use a interp__builtin_ia32_shuffle_generic/evalShuffleGeneric callback however
</details>

Open `/app/security/entity_analytics_entity_store` 2. On the top right corner, double (or multiple) click on the toggle to enable entity store **Expected behavior:** Entity store is enabled without errors. **Screenshots (if relevant):** The errors are not always the same, depends on the concurrent creation of resources. But e.g.
comments: Similar thing happens with quick setup/teardown in integration tests. Might want to check what API calls are being made underneath (enable/disable/restart).

Hello @romulets, @kubasobon and  team,

I see that issue **#229418** is unassigned and marked as **`good first issue / low hanging fruit`**.

This sounds like a classic front-end debounce/throttle issue where the UI is allowing multiple rapid API calls (enable/disable) before the first one completes, which then leads to race conditions and errors on the backend, as @kubasobon noted.

The fix would involve implementing a simple **debounce or throttle mechanism** on the toggle's click handler to prevent rapid, concurrent state changes.

I am confident I can implement this protective measure quickly and would like to take ownership of this issue. Could you please assign it to me?

Thanks!

issueDTO.title: Plot function cannot fix absolute color scale across multiple images
issueDTO.description: ### Environment (optional) _No response_ ### Describe the feature The current ``deepinv.utils.plot`` function only supports two normalization modes before plotting: - per-image min???max rescaling - clipping between [0, 1] However, in many real world applications (for instance tomography), images must be plotted using a shared absolute scale. The plot utility should support a shared color scale. The current implementation only allows for individual rescales, which makes it unusable for most real-world evaluation or publication purposes. Here's a simple example showing how different the plots can look: ```python import deepinv as dinv import matplotlib.pyplot as plt x = dinv.utils.load_example("butterfly.png", img_size=(128, 128), grayscale=True) physics1 = dinv.physics.PoissonNoise(gain=1 / 5) physics2 = dinv.physics.PoissonNoise(gain=1 / 100) y1 = physics1(x) y2 = physics2(x) print(y1.min(), y1.max()) print(y2.min(), y2.max()) dinv.utils.plot( [x, y1, y2], titles=["Ground-truth image", "Noisy measurement 1", "Noisy measurement 2"], figsize=(10, 4), ) fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(10, 4)) vmin = min(x.min().item(), y1.min().item(), y2.min().item()) vmax = max(x.max().item(), y1.max().item(), y2.max().item()) im0 = axes[0].imshow(x.squeeze(), cmap="gray", vmin=vmin, vmax=vmax) axes[0].set_title("Ground-truth image") axes[0].axis("off") im1 = axes[1].imshow(y1.squeeze(), cmap="gray", vmin=vmin, vmax=vmax) axes[1].set_title("Noisy measurement 1") axes[1].axis("off") im2 = axes[2].imshow(y2.squeeze(), cmap="gray", vmin=vmin, vmax=vmax) axes[2].set_title("Noisy measurement 2") axes[2].axis("off") plt.tight_layout() plt.show() ``` Output: ### Motivation Many of the deepinv users work on quantitative applications where units matter, and they can't use our plotting function for their plots. ### Alternatives considered _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_
comments: Good point @Tmodrzyk , I noticed this too and plan to take this up when I add the 3D plotting utilities into the trainer for #804 !

Agreed @Tmodrzyk ! My current workaround hack is to do something like

```python
lims = [-3, 7] 
def prep(x): return (x - lims[0])/(lims[1]-lims[0])
dinv.utils.plot([prep(a), prep(b)], rescale_mode="clip")
```

issueDTO.title: Wrong error message when a provided mTLS secret is missing
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Hey!

I've noticed a strange behavior when trying to create a mesh with mTLS.

When providing secrets, if one them is present but not the other one, the error message is wrong:

```
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl get mesh default
NAME      mTLS   METRICS   LOGGING   TRACING   LOCALITY   ZONEEGRESS   AGE
default   off    off       off       off       off        off          24s
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl get secrets
MESH      NAME                                    AGE
default   dataplane-token-signing-key-default-1   35s
$ cat /tmp/ca-key 
type: Secret
name: manually-generated-ca-key
mesh: default
data: 
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl apply -f /tmp/ca-key 
$./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl get secrets
MESH      NAME                                    AGE
default   dataplane-token-signing-key-default-1   1m
default   manually-generated-ca-key               3s
$ cat /tmp/mesh.yaml 
type: Mesh
name: default
mtls:
  enabledBackend: ca-inline
  backends:
    - name: ca-inline
      type: provided
      conf:
        cert:
          secret: manually-generated-ca-cert
        key:
          secret: manually-generated-ca-key
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl apply -f /tmp/mesh.yaml 
Error: Could not update a resource (Resource is not valid)
* mtls.backends[0].conf.cert: could not load data: Resource not found: type="Secret" name="manually-generated-ca-cert" mesh="default"
* mtls.backends[0].conf.key: could not load data: Resource not found: type="Secret" name="manually-generated-ca-cert" mesh="default"
```

Here, we would expect only one error message, for the cert that is missing. The key should not be mentioned.

For the record, when I add the cert, it works (meaning that the key was there before):

```
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl apply -f /tmp/ca-cert 
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl get secrets
MESH      NAME                                    AGE
default   dataplane-token-signing-key-default-1   5m
default   manually-generated-ca-cert              2s
default   manually-generated-ca-key               3m
$ ./build/artifacts-darwin-amd64/kumactl/kumactl apply -f /tmp/mesh.yaml
$ 
```

issueDTO.title: Visual Indicator for Modified / Unsynced Tasks on Frontend
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When editing or adding tasks on the frontend, it???s hard to remember which items were modified locally but not yet synced with the backend (CLI). This can cause confusion about what???s already pushed and what???s still pending.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

1. Whenever a task is added or edited on the frontend:
2. Mark it visually with an icon, color tag, or subtle indicator (e.g., 🟡 dot, ?????? symbol, or ???unsynced??? badge).
3. These indicators clearly show which items have been modified on the frontend but not yet synced.
4. After a successful sync with the backend, CCSync should reset all these indicators, so the user knows everything is now synced and clean.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

1. Keeping track mentally (error-prone).
2. Relying on timestamps (not intuitive in UI).

**Additional context**
1. Could be implemented as a small visual overlay or CSS class change on task cards/lists.
2. Optionally, hovering over an unsynced task could show ???Pending sync?????? tooltip.

**Impact**
Improves developer and user clarity at a glance, one can see what???s new or modified locally.
Makes syncing feel transparent and reliable, especially during active development cycles.

issueDTO.title: Socket.SendFile should fail if when Socket.Blocking = false
issueDTO.description:
If you put a socket into nonblocking mode (i.e. set Socket.Blocking=false) and then call synchronous SendFile, you get unexpected behavior.

On Windows, the call will block but will ultimately succeed.
(EDIT: See my comment below for clarification.) _On Linux, you will likely end up with an EWOULDBLOCK result, but this isn't not reliable; sometimes the call will succeed, sometimes it will send partial data, etc._ 

SendFile is not intended to be used in nonblocking mode. If a user attempts this we should throw InvalidOperationException.

More details here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/47230#pullrequestreview-572598591
comments:
Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/ncl See info in area-owners.md if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
If you put a socket into nonblocking mode (i.e. set Socket.Blocking=false) and then call synchronous SendFile, you get unexpected behavior. On Windows, the call will block but will ultimately succeed. On Linux, you will likely end up with an EWOULDBLOCK result, but this isn't not reliable; sometimes the call will succeed, sometimes it will send partial data, etc. SendFile is not intended to be used in nonblocking mode. If a user attempts this we should throw InvalidOperationException. More details here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/47230#pullrequestreview-572598591
Author: geoffkizer
Assignees: -
Labels: `area-System.Net.Sockets`
Milestone: -
Triage: We should throw as suggested above. Should be fairly straightforward to do.

Just to understand it better this bug fix would be checking for blocking =false in every synchronous method and throw in case of it is false need to throw invalid operation exception , is my understanding towards this bug is correct?

> On Linux, you will likely end up with an EWOULDBLOCK result, but this isn't not reliable; sometimes the call will succeed, sometimes it will send partial data, etc.

On Linux this should work.

`sendfile` works the same as `sendmsg`: you need to call it again until everything was sent, and in case of `EAGAIN/EWOULDBLOCK` wait for `poll`.

`TryCompleteSendFile` is missing some logic that calls it again on partial sends, like what we have in `TryCompleteSendTo`.

Yeah, my comment above is wrong/confusing.

I should have said, on Linux, the kernel will buffer as much of the file as it can/wants to, and then tell you how much it sent, just like any other send operation. This will likely result in EWOULDBLOCK if you need to call sendfile multiple times, but that's not the real problem.

The problem is, Socket.SendFile doesn't return a value telling you how much it actually sent, like Socket.Send does. So there's no way for the user to know how much of the file was actually sent, which makes the API pretty useless.

We could in theory add a new method that returns the bytesSent. But there's no obvious way to make this work on Windows, since Windows doesn't seem to actually respect the non-blocking state of the socket for TransmitFile.

I think the conclusion still stands: we should just fail Socket.SendFile when Socket.Blocking = false.

> TryCompleteSendFile is missing some logic that calls it again on partial sends, like what we have in TryCompleteSendTo.

In what case in particular? It looks like we are doing the retry logic in SocketAsyncContext.

> Just to understand it better this bug fix would be checking for blocking =false in every synchronous method and throw in case of it is false need to throw invalid operation exception , is my understanding towards this bug is correct?

No, this is specifically about SendFile.

> > Just to understand it better this bug fix would be checking for blocking =false in every synchronous method and throw in case of it is false need to throw invalid operation exception , is my understanding towards this bug is correct?
> 
> No, this is specifically about SendFile.



ok so i need to apply blocking =false check for specific method of send file and this will fix this bug , asking because i want to make pr , so before that i need to be clear about what actually case of bug fix, Thanks
SendFile in when Socket.Blocking = false.

> In what case in particular? It looks like we are doing the retry logic in SocketAsyncContext.

We're not looping on partial sends like we do for `TryCompleteSendTo` until there is nothing more to be sent:
https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/4df29c9715659a7957ffeae8b79ba8b52d71ba02/src/libraries/System.Net.Sockets/src/System/Net/Sockets/SocketPal.Unix.cs#L883-L885

We are looping in TryCompleteSendFile:

https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/4df29c9715659a7957ffeae8b79ba8b52d71ba02/src/libraries/System.Net.Sockets/src/System/Net/Sockets/SocketPal.Unix.cs#L935

Ah yes.

Is there a test that occasionally fails on Linux that I can run?

I don't think there's an existing test, but there's discussion of what tests we should have here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/47230#pullrequestreview-572598591

@antonfirsov Did we add a (disabled) test for this?

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to fix the unexpected behavior of Socket.SendFile when Socket.Blocking is set to false. The issue is about throwing an InvalidOperationException when Socket.Blocking is set to false and providing a reliable way to send files in non-blocking mode.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to throw an InvalidOperationException when Socket.Blocking is set to false. The validation involves checking if the blocking is set to false and throwing the exception if it is.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix involves checking for blocking = false in every synchronous method and throwing an invalid operation exception if it is false. The fix also involves adding a new method to return the bytes sent. The fix is specific to the SendFile method and does not apply to other methods.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the unexpected behavior of Socket.SendFile when Socket.Blocking is set to false. On Windows, the call will block but will ultimately succeed. On Linux, the call will likely result in an EWOULDBLOCK result, but this is not reliable. The issue is about throwing an InvalidOperationException when Socket.Blocking is set to false. There are discussions about the issue, including adding a new method to return the bytes sent. The issue has been marked as a candidate for backlog cleanup and will be closed if no further activity occurs within 14 more days.

issueDTO.title: Terminal: highlighted (matched) search term CONSTANTLY overwrites clipboard
issueDTO.description:
<!-- ???????????? Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ???????????? -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.105.1 (Universal)
Commit: 7d842fb85a0275a4a8e4d7e040d2625abbf7f084
Date: 2025-10-14T22:33:36.618Z
Electron: 37.6.0
ElectronBuildId: 12502201
Chromium: 138.0.7204.251
Node.js: 22.19.0
V8: 13.8.258.32-electron.0
OS: Darwin x64 23.6.0

- OS Version: 
MacOS Sonoma 14.7.7 (23H723)


This looks like https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/151902 is still unfixed despite 4 years in making and being closed. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for a term in Terminal pane
2. Copy something into clipboard (not necessarily inside the Terminal pane, as in the video repro below)
3. Paste the copied term into the terminal _(or simply, interact with the terminal in any way),_ then paste again, and observe  that the clipboard item has been overwritten by your previous search term from the terminal.

To clarify: pasting action is not necessary to lose clipboard contents, it is simply for repro purposes. In real life scenarios, any interaction with the Terminal pane can replace clipboard if terminal search field is open and populated.

The way I see it, is that searching highlights found items (in terminal pane), and this highlighting acts as if user has selected something, hence copy-on-select is triggered and clipboard is replaced with the found / highlighted string.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/052fe079-3c7c-4c21-b36b-fd113ba0377d
comments: @Tyriar This has been a bug for 4+ years, how is still backlogged???
@movy this needs to be prioritized against the 13k other open issues. You're welcome to give us a hand and try fix it if you're passionate.
@Tyriar @movy Hi, I???d like to take a shot at fixing this issue, could you assign it to me.
If @vidmt steps away from the issue, I'd love to take a swing at it!

I'm not sure if this bug exist.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/467e4a4b-a724-438c-b1af-e5ae303d4a42

Are you @movy sure you have `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` to false on both user and workspace setting? 

If you have `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` enabled, then its expected that your highlighted term in terminal will be copied.

@anthonykim1, 
My `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` has been set to `true` for 25 years, but the way it is supposed to work is it _copies on selection_, i.e. user selected text -> it is copied to the clipboard, and it works as expected in VSCode terminal pane.

This issue is about unwanted behaviour when **highlighted** text (by search item) gets copied even when user does not select anything. If you select something, then paste it, selection gets deselected, i.e. it is certainly not the issue here.

I am not familiar with the codebase, and while it feels like it is related to `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection`, the **selection is being triggered by search item** IS the unwanted behaviour, and `copyOnSelection` just works as expected in such unexpected scenario.

I am on Windows using Zsh, i tried exactly what you did but it seems everything works correctly i would assume then its macOS related bug.
I will try to fix that problem.

Hi @Tyriar  and @anthonykim1 ,

I submitted a PR to fix this issue: [#276641](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/276641)???. The change ensures that the terminal find highlight does not overwrite the clipboard when CopyOnSelection is enabled.

The PR includes a guard in TerminalClipboardContribution to block programmatic selections from the find widget while preserving normal copy-on-selection behavior.

Any feedback or review would be greatly appreciated. thank you!
Hello I implemented a fix for the terminal copy-on-selection issue on Windows/macOS. Submitted PR #276734 for review

> Hello I implemented a fix for the terminal copy-on-selection issue on Windows/macOS. Submitted PR [#276734](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/276734) for review

Hey @souhil25 ??? I think your change blocks all selections while the find widget is open, even user ones. The goal is just to block selections triggered by the find widget itself.

repository.description: Visual Studio Code
repository.name: vscode

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to fix the unwanted behavior when highlighted text (by search item) gets copied even when user does not select anything. The user's intended content is overwritten by the unwanted search highlight when the find widget is open and a search result is highlighted.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires that the user has 'terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection' set to false on both user and workspace setting. The user's intended content is overwritten by the unwanted search highlight when the find widget is open and a search result is highlighted.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue has been attempted to be fixed by @Tyriar and @movy. @Tyriar has suggested to use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. @movy has implemented a fix for the terminal copy-on-selection issue on Windows/macOS and submitted PR #276641 for review. @vidmt has also suggested a fix by checking the selection's origin.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about unwanted behavior when highlighted text (by search item) gets copied even when user does not select anything. The problem is with the terminal find highlight overwriting the clipboard when CopyOnSelection is enabled. The fix requires distinguishing between a user-initiated selection and a programmatic selection (the search highlight, which should be ignored).

issueDTO.title: Add a parameter to set the UIKitInteropInteractionMode of IosMapView
issueDTO.description:
Hi, many thanks to this open-source library.

When implementing map element dragging with maplibre-compose 0.12.1, I observed that the drag function works correctly on Android but fails on iOS.

Upon investigation, the issue stems from UIKitView within IosMapView being set to _UIKitInteropInteractionMode.NonCooperative_???this blocks map element dragging on iOS. Conversely, changing UIKitView's UIKitInteropInteractionMode to _UIKitInteropInteractionMode.Cooperative()_ resolves the problem.

Therefore, would it be possible to add a parameter to MaplibreMap for configuring the interactionMode of IosMapView?
comments: If you agree that adding a parameter directly is feasible, I???d be happy to submit a PR.
Yeah, let's add this somewhere in MapOptions (GestureOptions maybe?)

> Yeah, let's add this somewhere in MapOptions (GestureOptions maybe?)

Okay, I'll try to submit a PR.

summary.otherNotes: many thanks to this open-source library, map element dragging with maplibre-compose 0.12.1 works correctly on Android but fails on iOS, UIKitView within IosMapView is set to _UIKitInteropInteractionMode.NonCooperative_ which blocks map element dragging on iOS, changing UIKitView's UIKitInteropInteractionMode to _UIKitInteropInteractionMode.Cooperative()_ resolves the problem

issueDTO.description: Seems like youtube music recently added the ability to add custom images to playlists! Can we extend `create_playlist()` and `edit_playlist` to take an optional argument (an image file) so that we can programmatically set it?
comments:
before that call^ there was a call to 
```
https://music.youtube.com/playlist_image_upload/playlist_custom_thumbnail?upload_id=AFiumC58THIgewkszL0aq8xbBLW1PSC-notrwUIrOnWDEkxSt0PDPf52HNC8x3xv7XIe1zwBXqOfCA6Ox9mW4dOF_KeC_YCzYro5hbDqGPe9UA&upload_protocol=resumable
```

with the payload containing the image data (my guess). and the response was 

```json
{
  "encryptedBlobId":"65jVDxiw9NQXhgph-9IlssToi-FoBdg68actYIIMK-vjU2o5Gq8QvK5H9PkpmMVZvtP7jQspWqJhprOnmyp1aQ=="
}
```

the same blobid passed to `edit_playlist`

and before that call^ was an empty request call to `https://music.youtube.com/playlist_image_upload/playlist_custom_thumbnail`

that returned 

```
x-goog-upload-url:
https://music.youtube.com/playlist_image_upload/playlist_custom_thumbnail?upload_id=AFiumC58THIgewkszL0aq8xbBLW1PSC-notrwUIrOnWDEkxSt0PDPf52HNC8x3xv7XIe1zwBXqOfCA6Ox9mW4dOF_KeC_YCzYro5hbDqGPe9UA&upload_protocol=resumable
```

in the reponse headers - which probably gives us the URL to call while uploading the image

issueDTO.title: Text and Boxes need flexShrink=0 where they should not shrink
issueDTO.description: ### Description Sometimes it incorrectly chooses start column when rendering (or rerendering) tasks list ### OpenCode version 1.0.12 ### Steps to reproduce _No response_ ### Screenshot and/or share link _No response_ ### Operating System macOS 26.0.1 ### Terminal _No response_
comments:
This issue might be a duplicate of existing issues. Please check:
- #3423: Also relates to todo/task list display problems in OpenTUI
- #3650: Similar spacing/padding glitches that affect element positioning in TUI sessions
- #3697: Display positioning issues that occur after window resizing in OpenTUI

Feel free to ignore if none of these address your specific case.
lots of artifacts there but not sure what's going on

@thdxr @kommander When there's not enough space to go around, it seems that flex gaps, margins etc are not honored, and some elements (like ``) get collapsed. This **o** here is actually part of **Todo** which got hidden due to lack of vertical space. But I'm guessing the renderer didn't issue the correct ANSI sequence to explicitly delete that **o**, and since no other text (or background color) took its place it just remained displayed.

What terminal is this? Looks like a grapheme width issue, the checkmark is just one cell, in many other terminals/fonts the checkmark is two cells, so the width calculation for the grapheme is off. What is the Unicode/raw by sequence for that checkmark?

Edit: Is there a message before this one that has any emojis/CJK chars?

@kommander Don't think this has anything to do with grapheme width necessarily. Check this out (pay attention to the **Context** text):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7f51f1ea-2f29-40be-a744-bc2ae18f7429

After I modfiy the code to set a background color on the `XX,XXX tokens` text, it doesn't show up anymore:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97cec708-d9fd-47d8-9e0b-8b690cca8e16

I don't see any special characters being rendered there: https://github.com/veracioux/opencode/blob/9fd672a1cb735eb7f8ec80ffbe9d7540e4687759/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/routes/session/sidebar.tsx#L52

This further confirms https://github.com/sst/opencode/issues/3775#issuecomment-3478404067 I think.

Ahh now I see what you mean. Okay that is curious. So by default all renderable yoga nodes are `flexShrink = 1`, so to avoid text nodes getting smashed into each other we can set `flexShrink = 0` on the <box> containers for the <text> nodes. Then the container does not shrink and the text nodes do not overlap.

Cool, Just doing some testing, then Ill get this PR out 🫡

issueDTO.title: Docker-compose.yml requires compose v2 (Readme issue)  /  .env path mismatch (environment specific?) in docker-compose
issueDTO.description:
https://github.com/elie222/inbox-zero/blob/1f3bb2b3f486ffa393430c4547d4b2c0fee6e466/docker-compose.yml#L45

Running on Debian, docker-compose.yml does not work on v1.x versions of compose (Default for any Debian stable release):
``` bash
??????milan$docker-compose up -d 
ERROR: The Compose file './../../docker-compose.yml' is invalid because:
'name' does not match any of the regexes: '^x-'
```

Had to install docker-compose v2 from experimental branch, then:

``` bash
docker-compose up -a
```
now becomes 
``` bash
docker compose up -a
```

produces the following error
``` bash
WARN[0000] The "UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string. 
WARN[0000] The "UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string. 
env file <omitted_local_path>/inbox-zero/.env not found: stat <omitted_local_path>/inbox-zero/.env: no such file or directory
```
Updating aforementioned line in docker-compose to use './apps/web/.env'  fixed the issue.
comments:
Hi @elie222, I've opened PR #411 to address the `env_file` path confusion mentioned in this issue. It changes the `docker-compose.yml` file to point the `web` service's `env_file` directly to `apps/web/.env`, simplifying the setup for Docker users.
I just ran into the UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN issue when installing locally. The specific issue, as I understand it, is that the docker-compose.yml file looks to the "root" environment for variables, not the `apps/web/.env` environment. I think this can be 

I addressed it with a quick short-term fix:

```
export UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN=token-string-here
```

And then I created a .env at the root level of the project with the `UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN` env variable.

That seems to work on a restart of the docker container, but I'm not convinced it's not relying on the old env var.
The file `apps/web/.env` does NOT exist in the repository which breaks the compose file - this should exist and contain reasonable defaults. Currently it points to a non existing file and breaks the config:

```
??? docker compose config
WARN[0000] The "UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.
WARN[0000] The "UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.
env file /home/karol.kozlowski/wa/inbox-zero/apps/web/.env not found: stat /home/karol.kozlowski/wa/inbox-zero/apps/web/.env: no such file or directory
```

As a result it breaks any form of managing multiple compose files (overrides) described in the official documentation: https://docs.docker.com/compose/how-tos/multiple-compose-files/

I've opened #954 to address this.

repository.name: inbox-zero

summary.attemptedFixes: The issue was fixed by updating the docker-compose.yml file to use './apps/web/.env' and by setting the UPSTASH_REDIS_TOKEN variable. A PR was also opened to address the env_file path confusion.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the docker-compose.yml file requiring compose v2, and there being a path mismatch for the .env file. issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Do not use `new Date().getTime()` for generating SSE events IDs
issueDTO.description:
Extracted from code review comment:

![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

Using `new Date().getTime()` for Server-Sent Event (SSE) IDs is not guaranteed to produce unique IDs, especially if multiple events are generated within the same millisecond. This could lead to issues with clients that rely on unique event IDs. According to the SSE specification, the `id` field should uniquely identify the event, which is crucial for features like resuming connections.

A more robust approach would be to use a counter initialized before the `try` block (e.g., `let eventId = 0;`) and increment it for each event. This change should also be applied on line 63.

_Originally posted by @gemini-code-assist[bot] in https://github.com/a2aproject/a2a-js/pull/162#discussion_r2489784306_

repository.description: Official JavaScript SDK for the Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol
repository.name: a2a-js

summary.main: Replace `new Date().getTime()` with a counter for generating SSE event IDs to ensure unique IDs
summary.validationOrRequirement: SSE specification requires unique event IDs, using counter initialized before the try block (e.g., let eventId = 0;) and incrementing it for each event is a more robust approach
summary.attemptedFixes: none mentioned
summary.otherNotes: Extracted from code review comment, originally posted by @gemini-code-assist[bot] in https://github.com/a2aproject/a2a-js/pull/162#discussion_r2489784306, labeled as good first issue

issueDTO.title: Convert `Offset` type alias into newtype
issueDTO.description:
Newtypes allow to constrain what operations make sense on a value in order to prevent mistakes.

Please consider what operations would make sense for the `Offset` type alias and provide a newtype instead -- please see the thread at: https://lore.kernel.org/rust-for-linux/CANiq72m_LSbyTOg2b0mvDz4+uN+77gpL8T_yiOqi1vKm+G4FzA@mail.gmail.com/

At the time of writing, the patches would need to be based on top of that patch series to update the upcoming users.

Please take the chance as well to write a couple examples/tests for the newtype.

Related: https://github.com/Rust-for-Linux/linux/issues/1203.
Related: https://github.com/Rust-for-Linux/linux/issues/1204.
Cc: @dakr

---

This requires submitting a proper patch to the LKML and the Rust for Linux mailing list. Please recall to test your changes (including generating the documentation if changed, running the Rust doctests if changed, etc.), to use a proper title for the commit, to sign your commit under the Developer's Certificate of Origin and to add a `Suggested-by:` tag, and a `Link:` tag to this issue. Please see https://docs.kernel.org/process/submitting-patches.html and https://rust-for-linux.com/contributing for details.

issueDTO.title: Split examples/account_allowance_hbar.py in two examples
issueDTO.description:
🧠 Problem
We have one file called examples/account_allowance_hbar.py

This demonstrates two key transactions:
1. AccountAllowanceApproveTransaction for hbar
2. AccountAllowanceDeleteTransaction for hbar

This means it is hard for a user to find the right example file for the transaction
src/hiero_sdk_python/account/account_allowance_approve_transaction.py
src/hiero_sdk_python/account/account_allowance_delete_transaction.py

It would be easier if we refactor examples/account_allowance_hbar.py into:
examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py
examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py
Then users can easily find the correct example for the transaction they want to study or use.

💡 Solution
Refactor examples/account_allowance_hbar.py into two files:
- examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py
- examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py

Note:
- Each file should be runnable and work (uv run examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py or uv run examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py) and actually work (you'll need to set up a Hedera portal account see README.md and create a .env file with your operator key and operator id in the format of .env.example)
- Each file should go through all the preliminary steps to be able to delete or approve a transaction for hbar (such as set up env, create accounts, transfer transaction)

👩???💻 Implementation Steps
- [ ] Read src/hiero_sdk_python/account/account_allowance_approve_transaction.py
- [ ] Read src/hiero_sdk_python/account/account_allowance_delete_transaction.py
- [ ] Create examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py, examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py


For examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py you'll likely need:
def setup_client():
    """Initialize and set up the client with operator account using env vars."""

def create_account(client):
    """Create a new Hedera account with initial balance."""

def approve_hbar_allowance(client, owner_account_id, spender_account_id, amount):
    """Approve Hbar allowance for spender"""

def transfer_hbar_with_allowance(client, spender_account_id, spender_private_key, amount):
    """Transfer hbars with allowance"""

def main():
    """
    Demonstrates hbar allowance functionality by:
    1. Setting up client with operator account
    2. Creating spender and receiver accounts
    3. Approving hbar allowance for spender
    4. Transferring hbars using the allowance
    """
Use this as a rough guide - make it as a good and as similar to the current example as possible



For examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py you'll likely need:
def setup_client():
    """Initialize and set up the client with operator account using env vars."""

def create_account(client):
    """Create a new Hedera account with initial balance."""

def approve_hbar_allowance(client, owner_account_id, spender_account_id, amount):
    """Approve Hbar allowance for spender"""

def transfer_hbar_with_allowance(client, spender_account_id, spender_private_key, amount):
    """Transfer hbars with allowance"""

def delete_hbar_allowance(client, owner_account_id, spender_account_id):
    """Delete hbar allowance by setting amount to 0"""

def transfer_hbar_without_allowance(client, spender_account_id, spender_private_key, amount):
    """Transfer hbars without allowance"""

def main():
    """
    Demonstrates hbar allowance functionality by:
    1. Setting up client with operator account
    2. Creating spender and receiver accounts
    3. Approving hbar allowance for spender
    4. Transferring hbars using the allowance
    5. Deleting allowance
    6. Tranferring again and seeing it fails
    """
Use this as a rough guide - make it as a good and as similar to the current example as possible

🧰 Requirements
- [ ] These examples must be able to be run! and must run!
- [ ] To help you identify if your methods are valid or invalid, please read docs/sdk_developers/pylance.md, and install pylance, this helps you spot errors. Refer to other /examples for each transaction type to see how to do the transactions you need - AI will get it wrong as the python sdk is slightly different to other sdks on the web!
- [ ] All functions you need to pull and use in this example must be called at the top of your script - make sure the path is correct (see project_structure.md), for example 

from hiero_sdk_python.tokens.token_associate_transaction import TokenAssociateTransaction

🧾 To Merge
In order for your PR to be able to be merged it needs:
- [ ] DCO and GPG key signing (git commit -S -s -m ".....") <- view docs/sdk_developers/signing.md
- [ ] A changelog entry <-- view docs/sdk_developers/changelog_entry.md

Read CONTRIBUTING.md for more information

??? Acceptance Criteria
- examples/account_allowance_hbar.py is deleted
- examples/account_allowance_approve_transaction_hbar.py exists
- examples/account_allowance_delete_transaction_hbar.py exists
- Files run successfully against Hedera Testnet
- Functionality and good stuff about account_allowance_hbar is preserved
- All existing tests pass
- CHANGELOG entry added
- Commits are DCO + GPG signed

🙋????????? Next Steps
- Comment below to be assigned to this issue.
- Read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- Fork the repository and start implementing.
- When ready, submit your PR!

issueDTO.title: Create examples/topic_id.py
issueDTO.description:
🧠 Problem
src/hiero_sdk_python/consensus/topic_id.py defines the `TopicId` class.  
It???s a core utility for working with Hedera Consensus Service (HCS) topics ??? providing methods for converting between protobuf TopicIDs, string representations, and checksummed formats.

Currently, we do not have an example demonstrating how to use this class.  
SDK users, AI models, and contributors would benefit from an example showing how to create, parse, and convert `TopicId` objects.  

We **don???t** need an end-to-end example that interacts with the network or creates real topics ??? this class is purely for ID manipulation and validation.

💡 Solution
Add `examples/topic_id.py`

This example should demonstrate:
- [ ] How to manually create a `TopicId` instance
- [ ] How to parse a `TopicId` from a string (e.g. `"0.0.1234"`)
- [ ] How to convert to and from protobuf (`_to_proto()` / `_from_proto()`)
- [ ] How to generate a checksummed string representation using `to_string_with_checksum()`
- [ ] How to validate the checksum with a `Client` (testnet)

Since `TopicId` operations don???t rely on transactions or network writes, **mock data** and a **testnet client** are sufficient.

👩???💻 Implementation Steps
- [ ] Read `src/hiero_sdk_python/consensus/topic_id.py` to understand the class and its methods.
- [ ] Create `examples/topic_id.py`
- [ ] Import the files you'll be using, e.g.:

```python
from hiero_sdk_python.consensus.topic_id import TopicId
from hiero_sdk_python.client.client import Client
...
def create_topic_id() -> TopicId:
    """Create a TopicId manually."""
    return TopicId(shard=0, realm=0, num=1234)

def parse_topic_id() -> TopicId:
    """Parse a TopicId from string representation."""
..

def convert_to_proto_and_back(topic_id: TopicId) -> TopicId:
    """Convert a TopicId to protobuf and back."""
    proto = topic_id._to_proto()
    return TopicId._from_proto(proto)

def show_with_checksum(client: Client, topic_id: TopicId):
    """Display TopicId with checksum."""
..

def main():
    """Demonstrate TopicId functionality."""
...

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

🧰 Requirements
- [ ] The example must run successfully with: uv run examples/topic_id.py
- [ ]  Follow import structure and conventions from project_structure.md
- [ ] Read docs/sdk_developers/pylance.md and enable Pylance to catch SDK-specific typing and import errors
- [ ] Keep the example self-contained (no network calls or topic creation)

issueDTO.title: Create new documentation page on authentication
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

User authentication is a big topic for software application developers. I often see this as a common questions for devs new to the space - "how does authentication work on Ethereum"? They often (reasonably) bring mental models from web2 & want to understand how Ethereum users "sign in".

There's some existing resources when Googling "ethereum authentication" but the 1st result is this:
https://moralis.io/ethereum-authentication-full-tutorial-to-ethereum-login-programming/
Which I don't think is a great neutral resource, as it just pushes the user to create an account & use Moralis vs. actually explaining how things work & what options a developer has when adding authentication.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Create a new documentation page (perhaps under the "Ethereum stack" section) that covers how authentication works in an Ethereum context. This could be a fairly simple resource, explaining that this is typically handled by connecting an Ethereum wallet to an application via a client library like ethers.js, web3.js or Wallet Connect.

As part of this explanation it may be worth getting into how wallets & accounts work (i.e. the public-private key cryptography that allows users to sign messages proving control of an account).

This could also be a useful page to list emerging standards & best practices, like Sign in with Ethereum:
- https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4361
- https://auth0.com/blog/sign-in-with-ethereum-siwe-now-available-on-auth0/

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Perhaps we should also/instead add a page covering "Ethereum wallets", which we have an existing page on but not for developers who want to learn how wallets work & how they add wallet support to a software application.

**Want to contribute?**

We love contributions from the Ethereum community! Please comment on an issue if you're interested in helping out with a PR.
comments: Hi, I would like to contribute on this .

I would love to help contribute here - I'm Rocco from the Spruce team / co-author on EIP-4361. 

I think one of the main points the article should drive is the difference between connecting a wallet to an application and actually authenticating a session with a user. I described this [previously](https://blog.spruceid.com/sign-in-with-ethereum-is-a-game-changer-part-1/), breaking it down from connecting a wallet and what happens when you authenticate.

To break it down further into sub-topics that would probably be great for this:
- What is the difference between connecting a wallet and authenticating/signing in.
- Why signing a message is necessary for authentication.
- What can you do after authentication.
- Why standardizing SIWE was important for wallets, user experience, and user safety. 
- What is Sign-In with Ethereum / history of EIP-4361 
- Usage today / options for users.
This issue is stale because it has been open 45 days with no activity.

> @obstropolos Hey! Appreciate your original reply here and deep apologies that this got lost in the mix. Two years have passed but unfortunately there is still a void around this content.
> 
> Any chance you, or @mohammadobaid1, would still be interested in working on this? If it would help I can re-surface this as a new issue, but can also just keep it here.
> 
> Anyone interested please tag me here! 🙏 thanks!

Sure I'd be open to it @wackerow - what would be the best way of getting in touch about it?

Great, thanks @obstropolos! Can take a few approaches here... 

1. You could create a template/outline and post here to get your initial thoughts down for feedback before committing to writing an entire page; then use that to write the page for a PR
2. You could also brainstorm ideas in [out Discord](https://discord.gg/ethereum-org) and solicit feedback there before working on the PR.
3. You could just write a page and post as a PR... downside of this approach is potentially putting in a lot of work that hasn't gotten feedback and ends up needing a lot of re-work.

I would suggest either 1 or 2 above, and start with an outline draft on GitHub, either in draft PR or inside this issue. Don't hesitate to hop into the Discord though if you need to reach out!
Hey @obstropolos! Just circling back, curious if you're still interested in working on this. If not we can open up for others.. thanks!
Going to unassign and open this back up

yes @konopkja

feel free to start @seunbayo  with an outline proposal

So here is what I am thinking


## 1. Introduction
- Explain how authentication in Web3 differs from traditional Web2 logins.
- Highlight that Ethereum users prove identity by **signing with a private key** instead of using passwords.
- Clarify the distinction between **connecting a wallet** and **authenticating a session**.


## 2. Wallets, Accounts, and Signatures
- **Ethereum Accounts:** How public/private key pairs define identity.
- **Wallets:** Tools for key management and message signing.
- **Digital Signatures:** How users prove control of an address without exposing private keys.
- Quick code example: signing a message with `ethers.js` or `web3.js`.

## 3. Connecting a Wallet vs. Authenticating a User
- **Connecting:** Grants dApps access to a public address (no proof of ownership yet).
- **Authenticating:** User signs a message to verify they control the connected address.
- Illustrate how these two steps differ in purpose and security.

## 4. How Ethereum Authentication Works (Step-by-Step)
**Client-side flow:**
1. User connects wallet (e.g., MetaMask, WalletConnect).
2. App requests a nonce from backend.
3. Wallet prompts user to sign the nonce.

**Server-side flow:**
4. Server verifies the signature.
5. If valid, create a secure session (e.g., JWT or cookie).
6. User is now authenticated.

## 5. ???Sign-In With Ethereum??? (SIWE) Standard
- Introduce **EIP-4361** and its purpose.
- Why SIWE matters:
  - Improves wallet UX and user safety.
  - Standardizes message formats to avoid phishing.
- Show a sample SIWE message.
- Mention libraries and resources i find
